Reviews.Title: “Great Location & Good Value”
Reviews.Author: EmilyyJayne
Reviews.Content: This hotel is just a 5 minute walk from Notre Dame, and in an area with plenty of restaurants, cafes and shops to browse. Great value - the cheapest hotel we could find in the area! We stayed in room 14 which was fine, I'd maybe ask for a room higher up as each night we could hear the hoover (?) in reception. Shower was great, safe in room was useful and bed was comfy. Only issue was the hairdryer, which for someone with thick/long hair, was useless, and reception didn't have another to lend us. Receptionists were always friendly although not too over the top. We didn't try the breakfast, went to a little cafe round the corner and made friends with the owner. Overall brilliant hotel, amazing location and a comfy place to sleep at night.

Reviews.Title: “Good 2 star”
Reviews.Author: IrishinItalyPenelope
Reviews.Content: Recently stayed at €120 night twin room fifth floor. Rue Thenard is quiet, but very central. Easily accessed via RER from Paris CDG airport (get off at Saint Michel-Notre Dame) and walk via the underground connection to Cluny - La Sorbonne station and exit (sortie) on Bd St. Germain on the Musee de Cluny side. It's easier this way than coming overground at St Michel and having to dodge traffic, pedestrians and lights with your luggage. Walk east on Bd. St. Germain, cross rue St. Jacques take the next turn right onto Rue Thenard. The hotel is 75 metres up on the left, opposite the Pre Verre restaurant (excellent value and good food - very handy!). The lift goes to the fifth floor (don't get a room on the 6th). We had room 52 (with balcony) a little tight for space (no chest of drawers). Bed was very comfortable. Decor a little faded but the hotel is clean and the room was scrupulously maintained during our stay. Bathroom very adequate with excellent shower and constant hot water. Breakfast was not included. Best breakfast locally is at the Brasserie Balzar at 49 rue des Ecoles about 150 metres away. €6 for glass of fresh orange juice, coffee, croissant and half baguette, butter and jam/marmalade. Main sights are all easily accessible. Notre Dame, Saint Chapelle, Musee de Cluny, Eglise St. Severin, Eglise St Etienne du Mont, the Pantheon, St Sulpice and St Germain des Pres are all walkable. From the same St Michel - Notre Dame station take the RER C5 (direction Versailles Rive Gauche) for Musee d'Orsay, Eiffel Tower and Versailles itself. (beware there are other Versailles directions, make sure you are going to Versailles Rive Gauche). Staff are pleasant and helpful and all the receptionists have good english. My only quibble was that the computer provided in the reception area does not have a printer attached. This means you have to email your online check-in page (once you have accessed it) to the receptionist's computer (which has a printer). This is unnecessarily fiddly and not easy unless you are good with computers (I am not). I had to get the receptionist to do it for me. Other than this we were very happy with our stay and would return.

Reviews.Title: “Exactly where you want to be in Paris”
Reviews.Author: Mike1227
Reviews.Content: I chose this hotel for my first stay in Paris for NYE 2011. It was a great value for the weekend compared to the inflated prices of everywhere else I researched. After staying in many other hotels in Paris, this one is still my favorite. Hotel: 4.5 The rooms at the hotel have a very nice size for Paris standards. A big comfortable bed, nice room size, and good storage space. We had a great view out the window as well. The lobby was nice, and very well kept. Staff: 5 Very helpful and informative. Good advice on restaurants, and help on how to get around. They spoke very good English. Location: 4.5 If you want to stay in a more authentic Paris setting, this is where you want to be. Still lively, it is more quiet and realistic. It is easy to find, and very easy to navigate the city from this area(using the metro and walking). Convenient the RER B line from the airport. Overall- 5 For the value, location, and comfort level. It was perfect for a smaller budget in Paris without sacrificing any of those aspects. I would recommend it for all traveler types.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in excellent location”
Reviews.Author: familytravel4x4
Reviews.Content: Booked the hotel months in advance - so far in fact I had to Email the hotel as their reservation page would not allow the booking! The response was friendly and helpful - Mr Ana take a bow. The hotel was great, clean and tidy with nice rooms. Albeit we had the best one on the 6th floor (whether it was because the standard room was not truely available or whether Mr Ana upgraded us given he knew we were in Paris to celebrate my wife's 50th birthday). Either way it was a nice experience. Breakfast was excelelnt and good value at 10 euros each (despite what other TA visitors may have written). We chose the hotel for its location (and TA comments) and we weren't disappointed - easy access to metro, and sites such as Notre Dame, the Pantheon, Luxemburg gardens etc. The Latin quarter is just perfect and lots of great restaurants too (Mr Ana booked one for us via Email before we arrived - most helpful). When next in Paris we will be back.

Reviews.Title: “Unforgettable stay”
Reviews.Author: MYLeeHeidi
Reviews.Content: I highly recommend this hotel because of it's excellent location, great hosts, very clean room, reasonable price, and lots of good restaurants nearby. The staff, the reception were helpful, the houskeepers were very nice, very friendly and did a great job. I especially appreciate the kindly help of Mr. Santa Ana, the nice and charming host. Their warm hospitality made my stay an unforgettable one.

Reviews.Title: “Good value, great location and warm welcome”
Reviews.Author: aelfred
Reviews.Content: Our room was warm and comfortable when the the weather outside was very cold. I love this part of Paris, lots of good restaurants and cafes, walking distance of the river and lots of sights. The hotel is on a quiet side street. We flew into Orly and used the Orlybus then the RER. The manager's directions to the hotel were spot on and enabled us to walk below rather than above ground with our suitcases in freezing weather to an RER entrance not far from the hotel. Staff were universally friendly and helpful. The room was small with a pretty little balcony, but no smaller than I expected in Paris at this price. The lift shaft was built into the room, restricting the space and creating a little noise but overall this did not spoil our stay. I fully intend to stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “I would stay here again!”
Reviews.Author: margo25
Reviews.Content: What i liked more about this hotel was the location-you are just a few steps away from Notre Dame at a very good price for the center of Paris! We had a double room which faced the street,but was not too noisy,the room was clean and you have a safe in the room which is good because you don:t have to carry all the money and passports with you.I will stay here again on my next visit!

Reviews.Title: “Clean hotel with all the basics but not for light sleepers.”
Reviews.Author: Klm9802
Reviews.Content: Pros: Incredibly clean, good location, friendly and helpful staff, had all the basics Cons: Noisy and a bit dated The hotel was in a good location, though a bit touristy. The rooms were very clean. Staff was helpful, spoke some English and seemed genuinely interested without being intrusive. The room was very basic and a bit dated in its decoration. Our one complaint was the noisiness of the rooms. We could hear the people speaking in the next room, could hear people tromping up the stairs, and the metal awnings make a banging sound in the rain. One night it was loud enough to wake up my husband who can sleep through an alarm with ease. If you are a light sleeper, be sure to get a room on the top floor or bring earplugs.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location, staff and rooms! Amazing value for money!”
Reviews.Author: Sharissa L
Reviews.Content: My partner and I stayed at the Hotel du College de France for the few days leading up to new years and absolutely LOVED it! Not only was the location easy to get to from the airport but central to most of the tourist attractions that we wanted to see (and if not the metro was just around the corner!).. We found the owner and staff to be extremely welcoming, friendly and accomodating, answering any questions we had and going out of their way to help us as best they could. The rooms were warm and cosy and everything was overall thoroughly enjoyable. We definitely recommend this place as somewhere worth staying in Paris! We will no doubt be back there again!

Reviews.Title: “basic room with the best service, most friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: jezzebelmona
Reviews.Content: We loved our stay here for the week. Mr. Sadr and Mr. Santa Ana were the nicest hosts and did everything to make our stay comfortable. The room was very basic and not large but that is how it is in France. We had a very hot shower and decent sized bathroom. We only ate breakfast one day as it was a bit expensive but in retrospect, it is wise to eat at the hotel if you are an early riser as breakfast is not served anywhere until close to 9am. The area is very nice, near the university, it can be loud since there are students around all the time but it's safe and very close to the major attractions. You also have 2 metro stations literally minutes from the hotel. We loved talking with Mr. Sadr in the mornings, he is very nice and helpful with any questions. He even printed out our boarding passes for us tonight as we are leaving very early tomorrow. Stay at this hotel, it's perfect if you plan to really sightsee and want a place to sleep and shower comfortably, you will be treated well.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing location, great staff”
Reviews.Author: Terri M
Reviews.Content: My daughter and i spent a week in Paris this December and stayed in the Hotel du College de France. What a joy and treat this find was. The staff was extremely helpful and kind, the location wonderful and the room and ammenities excellent. I highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “No-frills room in fantastic location - give it a go”
Reviews.Author: ardief
Reviews.Content: The location of this hotel is perfect - in the heart of the University district, with lots of lovely cafes' for breakfast, round the corner from the RER (two stops from the Gare du Nord for Eurostar/direct line to Charles de Gaulle for flights), and not far from a metro line at Odeon. The price was right, too - and we enjoyed the reliable, free wi-fi. Don't expect a beautiful room though - it was basic, but clean. The bed is comfortable and there is a nice tv, a desk, and plenty of space for your things, the shower was hot and powerful, but the towels are a bit....minmalist, and threadbare, and the soap and shower gel were barely adequate for two people for two days (not replenished). We didn't try the breakfast as we thought it was a bit overpriced. We had a good stay - though I would recommend avoiding room 10, next to the breakfast area - and though it's not my favourite hotel in the world, it provided a comfortable base for our Parisian weekend.

Reviews.Title: “Our go to hotel...”
Reviews.Author: Ross_Belinda_Aust
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at this hotel on three occasions for 3-4 days each time, once in May 2009 and twice in July 2010. It is the only place we have stayed in Paris. The location just can't be beaten and it is perfect for catching the metro from the airport. The location and ease to get there was why we originally chose this hotel. However it has much to offer besides it's location, with the staff being very welcoming with a a great sense of humour and the rooms doing all they need to while being clean and homely. We feel right at home when we stay here and we will be staying here again on our next trip, no questions asked. Recommend Rue Mouffetard, which is only a short walk away, for great restaurants and the weekend market.

Reviews.Title: “Good hiotel, but inadequately suspicious staff”
Reviews.Author: TemurTbilisi
Reviews.Content: Location is great, and the hotel is good, but the staff is permanently suspicious of your spoiling something in the room. They keep peeping in on various pretexts. It would have been ridiculous to bear this had not I paid for several nights in advance. Besides, they cannot refrain from making constant comments on what they think is the way you should be doing. Regrettably, almost no private space in that otherwise good hotel. I would have advised them to change management, had not the managing guys been the owners themselves. They have been all but friendly, especially those whom I identified as the younger generation.

Reviews.Title: “Good location - Great value”
Reviews.Author: MarioCavarodosi
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the hotel for seven days at the end of November. Reaching the hotel from CDG via the RER was cheap and easy. We were on the fifth floor in one of the "balcony" rooms. The weather was unusually warm that week but it was still a bit too chilly to make much use of the balcony. One of the "standard" rooms would have sufficed. The room was clean and quiet. The in-room TV has a good selection of channels in half a dozen languages. Wifi was available in the room and was quite convenient. The location makes it easy to walk to almost everything you want to see and do. We tried the breakfast a couple of times and liked the everything -- except for the coffee: If you really want cafÃ© au lait with real espresso coffee (which we did), you should walk the two blocks to Blvd. St. Germain and hit the Segafredo. Overall, we think the price and quality of the hotel are tough to beat.

Reviews.Title: “A brilliant location for exploring the main attractions of Paris”
Reviews.Author: Danielle D
Reviews.Content: I stayed with a friend for one night at this hotel. The best thing about it has to be it's central location for exploring along the Seine, Notre Dame, Jardine de Luxenbourg, the Marais, Champs Elysees, the Louvre, Musee D'Orsay. We had a room with a balcony which overlooked the rest of the street. We had an ensuite shower and a tv in our room. The hotel owner is very friendly and personable and speaks good English. The main aim of our trip wad to wander around macaron shops, have lunch in the Place Des Voges and do some sight seeing, so this suited us very well. Happy memories :)

Reviews.Title: “Best place to stay in Paris !”
Reviews.Author: decla1983
Reviews.Content: I've been to the Hotel du CollÃ¨ge de France many times for more than 10 years. And it's always have been a wonderful experience. The staff is great, always there for you if you have a problem or need indication. The room a great, comfortable bed, clean bathroom. The decor is really nice. The breakfast a good and cheap price ! And most of all ... the location ! For the price, I haven't found a better place to go. Even hostel aren't a better deal. Can't wait to go back again !!

Reviews.Title: “Great stay”
Reviews.Author: uselessrambler3
Reviews.Content: Top 5 things about this hotel (1) Location - fantastic (2) Cleanliness (3) Breakfast (really a bargain at 10 euros). (4) Friendly staff (5) Decor of hotel (plenty of mirrors). Thank you for a great stay Richard & Monika

Reviews.Title: “Full marks for Hotel du College de France”
Reviews.Author: taff37
Reviews.Content: A small, clean, charming, Value for Money 2* hotel, with character, set in a safe, quiet street on the edge of the Latin Quarter that provided a wonderful base for a 3 day visit to Paris. HdCdF is close to The Pantheon, The Seine, Notre Dame, Jardin de Luxembourg and the Sorbonne and, with the St Michel Metro nearby, you can decide whether you want to see the City by foot, using the Metro or even by boat. The Hotel has 24 hr reception - with helpful staff - with smooth check in/check out procedures.and a small, but nice lobby. The hotel has small but very clean rooms, hot showers, comfortable beds, free wifi, flat TVs, hairdryer, free safety deposit box & good heating or ceiling fans (dependent on Time of year). Breakfast is an additional 10 euro per person per day - it is lmited but plentiful - & hit the spot. Our fellow clientele included several 'returners', most were older, English speaking and were interesting, friendly & polite. I suspect many had picked this Hotel following 'internet research' & spotted a good deal at a fair price. We were couples, on a Rugby trip, so we primarily wanted to eat & drink & be able to get around Paris easily. Mission accomplished. The 5arr/Latin Quarter is vibrant with bars, cafes, restaurants and quirky shops, The local student population were young enough to be our children - but..their presence meant that prices for eating & drinking were good for Paris. Our party particularly enjoyed the restaurants "Le Petite Prince" and "Au Bougnat" picked via TA reviews. We had a fantastic lunchtime on the nearby rue de Mouffetard - market shopping, sipping coffee, taking a few beers and being thoroughly entertained by very good, older, street musicians. HcDcF is a great Paris experience that does not 'bust the bank'!

Reviews.Title: “Tidy Hotel, Great Location”
Reviews.Author: fawkolgirl
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel based on Trip Advisor's reviews, and we were happy with our selection. Hotel is in the latin quarter, and is handy to all the major attractions. The room size for two people was adequate, and the decor was simple, the bathroom was modern and a decent size. We had two full length windows, which faced the street, and made the room nice and bright. As noted by the previous reviews the lift is small, but does the job efficiently. We did not have breakfast at the hotel, but did enjoy the coffee we ordered as part of the room service. Hotel housekeeping was excellant. The Hotel room rates are very reasonable. Handy to the Hotel, is a self serve laundry, grocery shop, coffee shops, metro, bus stops, restaurants. Hotel is only a 5-10 min walk to Notre Dame and The Seine River. Mr. Sadr provided excellant customer service. He helped us with all and any questions we had. We had a lovely stay!

Reviews.Title: “Very pleasant stay”
Reviews.Author: LJV1515
Reviews.Content: I stayed recently with a friend at the Hotel du College de France for two nights. I did a lot of research on reasonably priced hotels in the Latin quarter/St. Germain area prior to booking. The positive comments on TripAdvisor helped me to make my choice. Even though I made my reservation six months ahead, I was not able to get my first or second choice of rooms. I settled for the standard twin and asked to be put on the wait list for an upgrade. The hotel is obviously very popular as no upgrade became available. I asked at the front desk if they ever have a quiet time and they said luckily (for them) they did not. If you choose this hotel, book well ahead. This is a small hotel, typically Parisian in style. The hotel staff were welcoming and helpful. Our room on the third floor was small but had everything that we needed. Extra pillows were in the wardrobe. I was pleasantly surprised by the size of the bathroom. It was full size with bathtub/shower. The room had a safe. It was unseasonably warm for Paris in early October, however, there was a ceiling fan plus a floor air circulator â€“ not sure whether it was supposed to be an air cooler but it was sufficient to keep the room at a comfortable temperature. With the windows closed, there was no noise. We paid â‚¬10 extra for breakfast. It was a small buffet and certainly enough food for me â€“ cereal, juice, yoghurt, croissants, jams, French bread, cheese, ham and good coffee. The young lady who waited on us was extremely pleasant. I used the hotel computer to get our boarding passes â€“ something of an experience as the keyboard was the French version but I managed. We were able to leave our luggage after checkout as we were not departing until 6:30 pm. The hotel is just a couple of blocks from Notre Dame, located on a side street off the busy Blvd St. Germain â€“ an excellent location. We were close to the river cruise boats and tourist buses. There is a wonderful little market just down the street. This is a lively area so if you want something less hectic, this may not be the area for you. I would definitely return to this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Ask for room 62”
Reviews.Author: Hkj00
Reviews.Content: I stayed here twice in October 2011 with my husband, for three nights then for one night. It's in a great location, close to Notre Dam and a direct train to CDG airport (no need to change lines). Room 62 is the largest room and worth it to pay a little extra. There is a sweet balcony with table and chairs - perfect for eating cheese and drinking wine. There is also a partial view of the Eiffel tower - not enough to be called 'an Eiffel tower view room' but a lovely surprise. The hotel has a tiny lift (as do a lot of European hotels) so be prepared for stairs if you hate small spaces. Staff were friendly and helpful. You can email them your boarding pass and they will print it out for you. Highly recommend staying here. Ask for room 62!

Reviews.Title: “Very pleased”
Reviews.Author: Cruising-along
Reviews.Content: As others have said already, the location of this hotel is superb. That and the overall good reviews on Trip Advisor are the reasons we decided to give Hotel du College de France a try, and we're glad we did. Our flight from the US arrived too early for check-in, but we were allowed to stow our luggage in a small room. We spent the day sight-seeing and trying to fight the jet lag. When we returned later in the day, there were bags on top of ours (the room is very small) so maybe a larger room for bags would be better. But this room was right next to the front desk, and we felt secure leaving our (locked) bags there. It was unusually warm for early October, so the ceiling fan in our room was greatly appreciated! It never felt too warm. Also appreciated the comfortable bed and the free Wi-Fi and loved our corner balcony. We definitely would stay again at this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value for Paris”
Reviews.Author: L A
Reviews.Content: A great location - easy connection to the airport, next door to the Cluny Museum (one of my favourites), and walking distance to Notre-Dame and many other important sites. The staff is very friendly and helpful, the hotel is quiet and clean. Rooms are small, but comfortable. All rooms have good wifi connection (fast and reliable!) but there is no real business centre with printer. Plenty of pillows available! The heat was not on yet and it was a bit chilly, but not terrible.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, but it needs some improviments.”
Reviews.Author: WORLDSCITIZEN68
Reviews.Content: I stayed there with my wife and we really were expecting more, but it is still a friendly no frills hotel, below my opinion about it, overall pros: excelent neighborhood, with bar, restaurants, cafes, shops, brasseries etc. just some minutes walking. metro station 5 minutes walking or less. friendly staff some nice facilities as safety box, tv, bath the rooms was well cleaned everyday. cons: no air conditioner small rooms(but i think is normal to for a 2 stars in Paris) need some updates as in the lift and hall the matress it wasn't hard, but could be more soft there was a big glass window in our bathroom that could let those ones who are shy, really embarassed. p.s. I already knew before going to it that there wasn't air conditioner in the rooms, but as i was going in october, i thought the weather would be more cold, so i wasn't worried about. In fact, Paris was hot and i missed a climated room, even having a fan in the room.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel”
Reviews.Author: PandV--onthego
Reviews.Content: What a lovely hotel.....location was terrific, and the room was very clean and comfortable. We booked early and were able to get the room with the balcony...it had a small table and 2 chairs and we sat out every night and enjoyed our wine. The staff was very helpful and polite. It was a 5 minute walk to many majoy attractions including Notre Dame. Lots of restaurants in the area and a great supermarket just around the corner. Highly recommend!

Reviews.Title: “Europe 2011”
Reviews.Author: phclub1
Reviews.Content: This Hotel is located in the Latin quarter, on the left bank. The location has some noise but tolerable. The rooms are accessed by a lift so no problem getting bags to your room. Breakfast not include and I would skip this and find nice small cafe and enjoy the locals.

Reviews.Title: “Would stay there again”
Reviews.Author: johnt68
Reviews.Content: Great location near the southbank about 5 mins from Notre Dame. We had the room on the 5th floor with the balcony with rooftop views incl the eiffel tower. All good and room cleaned well - the ceiling fan was very welcome. Free internet was handy. Buffet breakfast was OK (â‚¬10 per person; desk staff perfectly pleasant. You're paying for the location which made this hotel great value.

Reviews.Title: “Good value”
Reviews.Author: KoffP
Reviews.Content: An honest hotel. Basic older style rooms and bathrooms, clean though. Location is lively with bars and restaurants, but this is a silent street. The restaurant accross the street is worth a lunch. Free wifi in the rooms. Metro nearby. Perfect for a tourist on a budget.

Reviews.Title: “Good, clean hotel”
Reviews.Author: shiraz457
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed in this hotel in November 2010. Our room was big enough for the two of us. Our bedroom had a small balcony with a table and two chairs. The bathroom had a tub and shower above the tub. The bathroom had doors opening onto a small balcony. It was wonderful to sit in the tub with the doors open. (We were on the fifth floor.) The people at reception were friendly and accommodating. We were close to the Seine and the Notre Dame and walked everywhere apart from our visit to Montmatre. The only negative thing was that there was no kettle in the room and I need coffee when I wake up! We are planning our next visit to Paris. Maybe September next year. Will book this hotel again. It was clean and affordable and close to most places.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location, great hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Randman59
Reviews.Content: After much research we decided to give this hotel a try, and was very happy. We were only there one night, but would have stayed much longer if possible. Great location, walking distance to everything. Rooms were small, but to be expected in Europe. Rooms were well laid out and very clean.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay!”
Reviews.Author: Sarah370
Reviews.Content: Wonderful place to stay. The Latin Quarter has tons of great dining and shops and is close to lots of tourist attractions. Very clean, free wi-fi, and always a staff member at the front desk so you feel safe.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Romer88
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed in a double standard room for 12 nights. This is a very clean hotel, the staff is very courteous and helpful and the location is great. There are many restaurants, cafes, bakeries and mini marts around the area. We used the metro a few times to get to places farther out, but otherwise, we walked everywhere. This hotel is just a few minutes walk away from Notre Dame. Breakfast was included in our package and it was wonderful. The servers were pleasant and very accommodating. Just a note for those who are not aware, there is no air conditioning in this hotel. The weather during our stay was wonderful. Mid 20's (about 78) during the day and 16 (about 60) at night. We had the windows open the whole time. It was very comfortable for us. Unless Paris gets some extreme heat wave, you won't miss the a/c. We would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location Super Helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: Chester T
Reviews.Content: I really can't add much to the earlier reviews except to say that this is the first time I stayed at a establishment without air-con. Fortunately weather at the time of our stay was cool but I imagine it would get a little uncomfortable on a hot summer day.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent”
Reviews.Author: RossDaniels
Reviews.Content: My wife & I stayed here in August 2011 for five nights. It is absolutely excellent. An extremely clean hotel with very helpful and courteous staff. The best feature is its location which is within a few minutes walk of Notre Dame Cathedral and the Louvre. Very highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the hotel and fabulous location.”
Reviews.Author: avalon_five
Reviews.Content: We loved this hotel and it was everything I hoped. Room was clean with lovely windows to the street. The location was fabulous and we walked everywhere.

Reviews.Title: “Great little boutique hotel in the Latin Quarter”
Reviews.Author: cashlm
Reviews.Content: Stayed here from the 13th-15th July in a single room. Plenty of space by Paris standards, comfortable bed. Very close to restaurants, five minute walk down to the Seine and Notre Dame and not far from Rue Moufftard. Metro and RER are also close by I didn't eat breakfast here due to dietary reasons but it looked good and was no more expensive than what the cafes around here offered

Reviews.Title: “Great ambiance and location!!”
Reviews.Author: JuneTrip
Reviews.Content: We stayed two nights and enjoyed our stay here. The room was clean, the staff was friendly and helpful. It was on a quiet street in the Latin Quarter and very easy to walk to Notre Dame. There was no air conditioning, just a ceiling fan which was not a problem since it was only in the 70's while we were there. We would stay again especially for the central location.

Reviews.Title: “Despite room choice we have booked again”
Reviews.Author: BonnieandClydeGomene
Reviews.Content: Very good value in terms of location but we made a bad choice of room, avoid the lowest price rooms, thyey only have a window to a lightwell, very stuffy in warm weather.. Staff were pleasant and helpful, the room was very clean but rather cramped. Very stuffy with a ceiling fan which was noisy on it's only working speed. A portable fan was provided but of limited effect. Also, the dining room is very small and was impossibly stuffy. We gave up on breakfast the first morning and went elsewhere (cheaper) for the rest of our stay. However, we have booked a slightly more expensive room for later this year, so a re-review may follow.

Reviews.Title: “"Excellent economical choice"”
Reviews.Author: armstrong57
Reviews.Content: We have been staying at the Hotel du College de France regularly for the past 10 years - ever since it was rated #1 among hotels in Paris. This two-star property is clean, in an excellent Left Bank location, and has most helpful persons at the front desk. It is located near 3 Metro stops, bus lines, and is steps from Notre Dame Cathedral, the Cluny Museum, the Sorbonne, the Ile St Louis and other important sites. If you are looking for luxury, this is not for you, but if you are looking for convenient, economical lodging you cannot do better. On our last visit we chose a room with a balcony with a table and 2 chairs (overlooking Paris rooftops) where we had cocktails before dinner. All very nice and highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Affordable and in a great location”
Reviews.Author: KJA3
Reviews.Content: I spent 4 nights in a double for single use at the Hotel du College de France in June. The hotelâ€™s location is great! It is only minutes by foot to the Notre Dame and is within easy walking distance to many of Parisâ€™s other highlights. And it is only minutes from several different metro lines and the RER line to Charles de Gaulle Airport. My room was pleasant. It was a decent size; the room got welcome morning light without getting too bright; closing the windows effectively shut most sound out of this generally quiet neighborhood; and it was accessible by elevator. Breakfasts were good. There is a non-qwerty computer available for guestsâ€™ use.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay.”
Reviews.Author: jennifereisme
Reviews.Content: I could not think of one bad thing to say about this hotel! We had the room on the very top which had the balcony with Eiffel Tower view and the room was PERFECT! It fit all our luggage (4 suitcases!) and still left us tons of room to move around!! I had heard Paris rooms were quite small but this one definitely wasn't one of them. PERFECT location to everything. 5 minute walk to Notre Dame, 15-20 minutes to the Louvre, and then we took the hop on hop off bus to the Eiffel Tower since there was a stop right near the hotel. Metro station super close as well even though we only took that at night and it cost us $45 euro to take a taxi to the airport. Overall I couldn't be happier with my choice and can thank all the Tripadvisor reviewers on helping me make this selection. Don't hesitate! Trust me I am a control freak and super picky and I was sooo happy! Oh and one more thing. The highlight of the trip for us was the River Cruise on the Seine. It was awesome and we got so many great pics!

Reviews.Title: “We liked it so much we went back two weeks later”
Reviews.Author: MainelyTraveler
Reviews.Content: This is an excellent hotel at a reasonable price in a fantastic location. It is close to the Metro and only a 5-10 minute walk to the Seine and Notre Dame. It is on a quiet side street near many cafes, shops and sites. We loved the hotel and stayed in two different rooms, as we started our trip in Paris and decided to return at the end of our trip. Lucky for us there had been a last minute cancellation and we were able to book a room for our second stay. Both rooms were lovely, very clean and comfortable. The hotel staff is very helpful and the desk staff all speak English. The lobby is very nicely decorated and comfortable for relaxing and the breakfast is well worth the 10 euro price. I highly recommend the hotel and will stay there again when I return to France.

Reviews.Title: “It was just ok--not as good as expected given the other reviews”
Reviews.Author: kdgAiken
Reviews.Content: The hotel was in a great location. We had adjoining rooms which was nice, but the rooms were a bit dirty and could have used a good cleaning. We were there on the weekend and it was a little noisy. The breakfast was good yet overpriced. The front desk service was just average as well.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in excellent location”
Reviews.Author: lrnnnn
Reviews.Content: My partner & I stayed in this hotel for 3 nights. We really enjoyed our stay. The hotel was lovely & had great character. It was in an excellent location, 2 mins walk to the metro with a good range of restaurants in the area. Our room was on the first floor & had two lovely big windows out onto the street below. Very good size, bigger than we expected for Paris. Staff were helpful, friendly & spoke good English. We were able to leave our luggage with them before check in & after checking out too which was very helpful. Would definitely recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay!”
Reviews.Author: histepper1965
Reviews.Content: We stayed in room 62 for 4 nights last month. The room was a nice size and it was spotless. We had a view of the Eiffel Tower from our balcony. We felt totally safe here and found the location perfect. The staff was friendly and helpful. I recommend this hotel and will stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “If you're set on staying in the Latin Quarter, great deal for the area”
Reviews.Author: vsaroyan
Reviews.Content: For Parisian standards, I was impressed with the size of the place and the airy feel of the room thanks to the fact that our room pointed south and was on a high floor. The hotel is very well situated nearby the metro and to the hipper areas of the quarter, while being on a quiet corner. The reception was also perfectly nice. An all-around good deal for the Latin Quarter.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel...in romantic Paris”
Reviews.Author: Redned08
Reviews.Content: Our arrival at this hotel was greeted with warmth and friendliness, We were booked into our room quickly and even though we arrived before the usual book in time we were able to access our room immediately. We were very thankful of this as we had been travelling for over 24hrs having been held up with closed airports and trains and were exhausted. We decided we would have a short nap before heading out to explore......I guess jet lag caught up with us and we woke up the next morning at 4am. Now the one downfall of a lot of Paris hotels (not just this one) is the lack of coffee/tea making facilities so I had to call down to the reception and ask for them to bring up some coffee as we were both hungry and thirsty...this was no trouble and we found during our stay that no matter what time they were happy to bring us drinks.....often as we walked in from the cold the gentleman on reception woud ask us if we would like a hot drink to warm up. The rooms are fairly small but adequate for our needs and certainly not cramped. The bathroom compact but adequate. Breakfast was continental but delicious...we had breakfast there about half the time and at nearby cafe's the rest of the time....it was 10 euros at the hotel and we often spent that much out in the cafe's but we would have a hot breakfast then. The hotel was located in the Latin qtr close walking distance to the Pantheon, Luxebourg gardens, Notre Dame in fact just about everything......even in the cold we walked down to the Eiffel tower. It is close to the metro, buses go up and down the main streets either side of the little street the hotel is in. There are plenty of great restaurants around. All in all this was a comfortable, clean hotel. Our time there was 7 nights.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent! Great location.”
Reviews.Author: sarah-blair
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 4 nights and it was great. The hotel was clean and the staff was friendly. the hotel room was small but for 2 people it was all we needed. We stayed in room 10 which was on the ground floor and it was great. The hotel is very close to metro stations and walkable to many attractions. we would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Small Nice Hotel in Paris”
Reviews.Author: ranchgaljean
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel in Paris and it was a nice place to stay. It was a little hard to locate at first, but then we didn't have any trouble finding our way back and forth to the bus stop and nearby shops and restaurants. The hotel is located just a few blocks from Notre Dame Cathedral. The rooms were small, but clean. The food in the breakfast area was very good. The hotel personnel were helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Satisfactory”
Reviews.Author: gorka
Reviews.Content: Hi all, This is a two stars hotel and thatÂ´s it. Perhaps my expectations were to high after reading all the comments in TA but this is my fault. It is a satisfactory hotel, clean, in a nice location ( as many other hotels in the city) but nothing special. Not cheap, not expensive...Two main cons: We stayed in room 64 and if you open the windows facing the interior patio it smells of drain so I pressume in the summer and with no air con, it must be very unbereable. The other con is the gentleman who was at the reception the day we arrived, the 26th of May, he did not check our passports, not our credit card, not our reservation, he did not look at us, and he even told us that there was not any place open for dinner ( at 22,50 hours in Paris), later on we discovered about 20 places around open for dinner at 23,00 hours...he just delivered the room key and say good night, perhaps he was very busy surfing the net. The other recepcionist during the stay were very nice. The taxi from Orly airport was 26â‚¬ and the taxi to Orly airport 35â‚¬. Would I stay here again? Probably, but I would check a few other places before....

Reviews.Title: “Great location! Comfortable room”
Reviews.Author: grammark
Reviews.Content: Brilliantly located in the Latin Quarter. Simple but good room with French doors off bed and bath rooms. Polite staff. So close to shops, restaurants, Notre Dame, Seinne cruises,etc. Will always come here when in Paris as it is great value.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel with wonderful staff!”
Reviews.Author: admire1230
Reviews.Content: Myself and one friend had a double room for 4 nights. We loved everyone at the front desk! The rooms were small but that was the case in all of our hotels in Europe. We had a balcony which was perfect for people watching at night while drinking wine and talking. The hotel is close to Notre Dame and the metro making sightseeing easy! Over all we really enjoyed our stay at this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Highly recommended accommodation”
Reviews.Author: Kate_Sounho
Reviews.Content: Even before I entered the hotel I loved its location that is so close to most of the popular destinations in the city. Very adjacent to Luxembourg Garden and the Lutece Arenas and many other which if I try to write here I might be caught in the spellingsâ€¦ lol. Jokes apart, my accommodation proved peaceful and comfortable. One of the greatest assets of this hotel is definitely its staff. They were very friendly and helpful. Looked curious to know if we needed something or not. Wonderful accommodation. Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Prime Location!”
Reviews.Author: staravalos
Reviews.Content: Right in the heart of the Latin Quarter! Nice friendly staff. I'd come back again.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous location in Paris”
Reviews.Author: jillmalt
Reviews.Content: Service was helpful and everyone spoke English. Ideal location just off Bould St Germain near Place St Michel. Room comfortable with good bathroom.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, well located”
Reviews.Author: Tash28
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the hotel for 7 nights. It was well located, close to train stations and the staff were helpful and friendly. The rooms were small but clean. Overall, we were happy with our stay.

Reviews.Title: “Parisiene Treasure”
Reviews.Author: Cammer10
Reviews.Content: This hotel is located in the Left Bank area of Paris on a quiet side street off Boulevard St. Germain. The rooms are clean with good sized bathrooms. Our room #52 had a balcony with ample room for two to sit outside and enjoy the view. This hotel is in a great location that allows you to walk to the Luxembourg Gardens, the Pantheon, Notre Dame, the University area and St. Chapelle within 15 minutes. There is a local market two blocks away on Blvd St. Germain on Tuesdays, Thursday and Saturday. The hotel has no restaurant but does serve a very decent morning breakfast that is well worth the 10 Euro cost. However the most endearing part of our stay was the staff at the hotel who were extremely helpful and pleasant. One person who should be singled out is Mr. Santana the front desk manager who was always smiling and quick with advice on how to use the Mero to get to other great sights in Paris such as Montmartre. His recommendations for supper at Les Caves de Bourgogne and Le Petit Prince De Paris were outstanding. Take his advise and get him to make a reservation for you. Both restauarants are frequented by local Parisiene's and the food is traditional. You will get excellent quality food at very reasonable prices. Another exceptional restaurant we found was La Petite Perigourdine which is a couple of blocks away from the hotel. We will definitely return to this hotel on our next visit to Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Superb Location--Walking Distance to Many Major Tourist Sights”
Reviews.Author: rgray2f
Reviews.Content: Facts: Staff friendly but very busy. Desk staff competent in English. Room clean, size typical of this class of Parisian tourist hotel. Wi-fi--"We Fee" unreliable/unstable on top floors. Three or four English language TV stations--business channels and world news. Across the street from a very popular restaurant--people talking, dishes, chairs, and tables moving about until 11:00 P.M. Closed on Sunday and Monday. Room has ceiling fan. No air conditioning. Large windows that open. Suspect that in summer the room would be uncomfortably hot until late in the evening. Elevator is the size of a large shipping crate--a casket comes to mind. Stairs are narrow and potentially dangerous for the elderly or clumsy.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly, Quiet, Perfect Location, Unbeatable Value!”
Reviews.Author: IDreamOfParis
Reviews.Content: My husband and I, along with another couple (in our mid-twenties), searched high and low for an affordable but convenient hotel for our three night stay in Paris in early May. I stumbled across this one by reading lots of reviews and forums, and I have to say that we were nothing but very pleased with the choice. It says it is a two star, but the rating system really is different than the US. I'd give it a three star based on the quality. The hotel staff was always courteous and eager to help(not to mention didn't mind speaking English with us), we got a great restaurant suggestion for our last night in the city by a staff member and it was fabulous. Our rooms were small (this is to be expected in Paris), but it was well kept and clean, and the bathroom had a tub and shower which was nice. The beds were pretty comfortable, we didn't have a problem falling asleep or hurting the next morning. It is in close proximity to all the major attractions, we even walked to the Eiffel tower, although this was a stretch even for us, our feet were nearly numb afterward! It is located on a (more quiet) street, though it is next door to the Latin Quarter. The only slight issue I would mention is the fact that you are required to be back to the hotel by midnight, which wasn't a huge deal to us (exhausted after our long days), but it may be for other guests. All in all, if you are looking for a hotel that is an excellent value and that's in the heart of the city, look no further. This is it.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, good value, clean.”
Reviews.Author: JimTVictoria_Canada
Reviews.Content: Stayed 9 nights, room was good size for Paris with ensuite. Hotel has been upgraded, clean and smoke free, on a quite side street. Would stay again. Elevator small, taking three pers or two with cases. Breakfast was buffet style with cereal, breads, coissants, cheeses, ham, yogurt, juice and tea/coffee, or chocalate. Close to RER B train, with entrance near Cluny (three blocks to hotel). Grocery stores with wine close by. Lots of cafes in area. Buses in area go to Eiffel Tower (#87) or #24 to St Lazare train (for Giverny) or #86 or #63 to Gare Lyon for trains to Fontenbleu. Price was quite reasonable.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Location, Perfect Service”
Reviews.Author: thornmist
Reviews.Content: After a quiet, uninspiring stay in the 7th district (not our hotel's fault, we simply weren't impressed by the area), we returned to Paris a bit nervous as to whether or not we would enjoy our experience. I'm happy to report that we were absolutely charmed by the Latin Quarter and the Hotel du College de France. It is a wonderful, reasonably-priced option if you want to stay in this part of the city and we found it very convenient to Notre Dame, Luxembourg Gardens, the fascinating Cluny Museum, the Pantheon (sadly closed for renovation while we were there) and Sainte Chapelle. We also walked from our hotel to the Orsay, Orangerie, and Louvre, which took about 20-25 minutes, although next time I would recommend taking the metro. There are several convenient metro stops, including the huge St. Michel/Notre Dame station which minimizes transfers and also puts you conveniently on the RER B line for the airports. There are a number of grocery stores nearby (we actually didn't find the closest one until our last day there, but it didn't matter), several restaurants and cafes, and also some McDonalds and Starbucks for those needing a taste of Americana. The area felt very safe, although there is a lot of traffic as one might expect. The hotel itself is quite charming, with a small sitting area in the lobby and a small breakfast nook. The breakfast is a reasonable-for-Paris-hotels 10 euro, although we never took advantage of it so have no comments as to its quality. There is a (small) elevator which goes up to the 5th floor. Our room was on the 6th. To access the rooms on the 6th floor, one must ascend and descend a spiral staircase, and the room itself is a bit attic-like with a sloping ceiling. If this is an issue for you, be sure to request a room on a different floor. Being on the top floor, we had a small view of the city which actually included the Eiffel Tower, visible through a gap in the buildings. There are several windows so the room is bright and airy, and the lights are controlled by slotting your key into the wall to turn on the electricity - not uncommon in European hotels. Nearly all hotel rooms in Paris are small, it must be said, but we thought ours was an acceptable size and furnished smartly for maximum effect. The tub/shower was high, and so one must be careful getting in and out, but the bathroom was otherwise fine and very clean. There is a notebook in the room which provides information on local sights, restaurants, markets, etc., and the code for the free wi-fi which was a bit slow but very reliable and useful. There is also a laptop downstairs, amusingly tucked into an old-style phone booth, for guest's use and the staff was very accommodating about printing your boarding passes. Indeed, we found the hotel staff to be extremely helpful and kind. The daytime clerk patiently made restaurant reservations for us one night, despite difficulties in communicating with the restaurant's hostess who didn't speak French. The night clerk was extremely friendly (and cute!) and was the one who helped us with our boarding passes and made us feel as if we were friends he was happy to help, rather than guests who were imposing. I typically prefer to stay in different areas when visiting a city multiple times, and so rarely stay in the same hotel twice, even when I liked the experience. However, I felt so comfortable and welcome here at Hotel du College de France, and felt that it was such a great value for the money, that I would be hard-pressed to want to stay anywhere else.

Reviews.Title: “Another great stay”
Reviews.Author: KnD.Moore
Reviews.Content: We spent 4 nights at the Hotel du College de France for my wife's birthday. This was our second visit and we were just as impressed as the first time. We really like the location of the hotel, just off the Blvd de St Germain and only a couple of minutes walk from the vibrant Cluny / St Michel / Notre Dame areas. We arrived early morning and although our room wasn't ready we were greeted warmly and allowed to leave our cases until the check in time of 1300. When we did check in we had room 44 which was a double room next to the lift. I initially thought this would be a problem but we barely noticed any noise from it. The room was small but clean, there was a free safe in the wardrobe, a hairdryer, tv and to my wife's delight plenty of mirrors. We had the 10 euro per person breakfast in the hotel each morning. You may be able to get cheaper elsewhere outside the hotel, but we enjoyed the selection of fresh fruit salad, orange juice, croissants, pain au chocolate, bread, cheeses, ham, cereals and yoghurts. Plus you could have as much as you wanted. The staff are wonderful, always greeting us with a smile and a warm welcome regardless of the time of day. They all speak excellent english which was a great help as I stumbled about with my poor french. This place is an absolute gem, I'm loathed to sing it's praises too much as it will make it too popular and more difficult to get reservations when we return in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value for the location, comfort and services. I'd easily stay here again.”
Reviews.Content: This hotel is an excellent value. For a fairly reasonable price when compared to other hotels in the Latin Quarter and nearby areas, the Hotel du College de France offers a lot. First, the location is fantastic. Walking distance from Notre Dame and all the sights/restaurants in the Eastern Left Bank, and not too far from the rest of the sights. Close to the Metro and RER stations. At the same time, it's on a quiet street and not crammed into the noisier parts of the quarter. Second, the room was comfortable. Small, but who cares if you're out for most of the day. The bed was comfy, the room was clean, it had a safe and a TV, and our third floor room had tons of sunlight. As a downside, the walls are a little thin so you can sometimes hear other guests at night. But I think this is the case at other hotels in the area, and the fan in the room provided the perfect white-noise solution. Third, the staff was super. Very friendly and very helpful with providing some local suggestions, making restaurant reservations for us, and giving us directions and info. It's just a two star hotel, so there's no pool, gym, etc. But if you just want a comfortable place to stay that is in a good, convenient location and is quite affordable, then this is a great fit. It's no surprise that of thousands of Paris hotels on TripAdvisor, this one is in the top 100. [PS - If you stay, get your pastries from the Kaiser patisserie two blocks away -- superb!]

Reviews.Title: “Hidden gem”
Reviews.Author: sall13h
Reviews.Content: I was pleased to find this on trip advisor at such great value and such a high ranking amongst 1800 hotels but I was not disappointed! This hotel is located in a great area which has lots of restaurants, shops and tourist attractions. The pantheon and mitre dame are 5 minutes walk, the louvre is 15 and the Eiffel tower if you want to walk is probably a good half hour. But the hotel is on the RER and metro lines so easy to get anywhere. The service was fantastic, rooms very well kept and cleaned and we were never bothered by a maid wanting to clean. They keep the keys at the front so they obviously know when you're in. This worked well for us as we had some late nights and slept in which would have been annoying being woken up by someone wanting to clean. Overall this hotel was very good in every way, I will stay there again over and over. Also they recommend a whole list of restaurants nearby, go to the Thai place it was excellent! There is also a place called mexi and co which is very laid back and not a restaurant as such but excellent cheap Mexican food and 2 minutes from the hotel

Reviews.Title: “Lovely find in the Left Bank.”
Reviews.Author: Dyanndesign
Reviews.Content: This smallish hotel was recommended by a seasoned traveler. Totally pleased. Friendly, quaint and convenient to wonderful little restaurants, metro and RER. Safe neighborhood. Definitely would return and highly recommend.

Reviews.Title: “What a gem!”
Reviews.Author: kianbu
Reviews.Content: After going to London and being holed up in a tiny room, this place was a breath of fresh air. On a lovely, quiet street - opening the windows and seeing the stunning architecture was a treat. We tended to use the curved staircase to get to our room, as it was a bit of a novelty and more comfortable than the small elevator. The room itself was clean and spacious with two large windows that let in plenty of light. The location was close to the Metro, and within easy walking distance to the Notre Dame Cathedral and the Pantheon. The staff were friendly and booking online (had to wait for a confirmation email from the hotel) was done within a day. Great deal for the price - it is well-kept and has charm to spare! If we ever are able to make a trip out to Paris again, we know where we'll be staying!

Reviews.Title: “VERY SMALL but great location!”
Reviews.Author: brotherman60763
Reviews.Content: We arrived and the lift to our room was a wonderful surprise! as we opened the door we found our room to be very small. I think parisian rooms are always small but wow. We had a bed (queen size) and maybe 3 ft on either side and thats it. We had a nice balcony and there wasn;t a lot of noise but some. For travelers who aren't going to be staying in the room a lot (sightseeing) its perfect. Cheap and clean with a lift. For people who like lounging in their rooms, not for you. The staff was very very nice especially the gentleman in the white shirt and tie and the owner. The only downfall was another heavier set gentleman (and when i say heavier in france i mean like kinda chubby). He was curt and rude and kinda made fun of us because we did not speak french, Very off-putting and almost made our stay un-enjoyable to be frank. So hopefully you won't have to talk to him.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, unbeatable price, friendly staff - All that you need!”
Reviews.Author: DonL21
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 2 nights after traveling from Barcelona, Spain. I must say this hotel is the best. Booked the double room with balcony and I can't truly asked for anything else. Reasonable size room (for Paris), balcony, and a nice bathroom. And, free wifi! :) I will definitely come back!!!

Reviews.Title: “Stop Looking, Book Here”
Reviews.Author: cjd212
Reviews.Content: The ONLY reason someone would give this hotel a less than perfect review is if that person needs four star luxury amenities. The only reason I'm reluctant to glow about this place is because I don't want the prices to soar before I visit again. Its super clean, the location is unbeatable... walk 2 minutes to the Seine with a bottle of wine in the evening, great wifi in the room, 2 metro stops, bars, there are grocery stores, cafes and a million restaurants nearby. The rooms are small but if you are going to Paris to walk around a hotel room then you shouldn't be reviewing hotels in Paris. The price is as low as you can get before you end up in a hostel or so far out that the 15 euro a night difference wouldn't be worth it. The double windows open up to the cobbled streets of the Latin Quarter, whoo! The economy stinks, unless you are considering a hostel, you won't get a better bang for your buck, stop looking, book here.

Reviews.Title: “Affordable stay in a great area of Paris”
Reviews.Author: jgabrielveras
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 5 nights in this hotel. Although the rooms are small, which seems to be normal in Paris, the hotel is a great choice for those who doesn't want to pay too much to be at Saint Germain. The location is fantastic, close to 2 metro stations, walking distance to Notre Dame, Louvre, Orsay and the Marais. The staff speaks english and is really nice and friendly. There is wifi in the rooms and a computer in the lobby. I would go again.

Reviews.Title: “OK”
Reviews.Author: spicyhippo
Reviews.Content: Location is very good, in Latin Quarter close access to two metro stations within minutes, about 15 minute walk to Notre Dame, 20 minute walk to the Louvre, 5 minutes from Pantheon. Many neighbouring restaurants and shops, supermarket literally over the main road 200 yards away to buy water, wine etc. Staff polite and helpful and price for Paris is very good but just a reflection of how expensive Paris is these days. Here is the but........this hotel is a 2 star hotel, I knew that when I booked, thatâ€™s the price I was happy to pay etc, and I have to say that is exactly what it is, 2 stars, itâ€™s not a 2 star pretending to be a 5 star or a 2 star thatâ€™s so great you could call it a 3 star, its 2 stars. The rooms are small yes as are most in Paris but I would say they are a little dated, blankets a bit worn, carpets a little trodden. I canâ€™t bring myself to give it anymore than 3 TA points because to fair it is just an OK 2 star hotel. When we checked out I looked at the top shelf of the wardrobe to check I hadnâ€™t left anything behind and it looks like the last guest or maybe even before them had left 3 empty Vodka bottles at the back of the top shelf wardrobe. Also the Power went out a couple of times while we were there and the front desk said it was us using a hairdryer that had blown it, funny enough used same hairdryer in many different countryâ€™s with different voltage no issues, had used it there for 2 days with no issues, then the power goes and itâ€™s the hairdryer fault. Would I stay here again, probably would but I do think that the hotel could spruce itself up a bit and buy some new towels and bedding, check all areas when cleaning, not try to be something itâ€™s not, just be a very good clean 2 star hotel.

Reviews.Title: “C'est si bon!”
Reviews.Author: Suvihuvi
Reviews.Content: Found this hotel from others' recommendations on Trip Advisor. So glad we paid attention. Biggest impression was its cleanliness (especially the private bath). The room was small as expected but sufficient, cozy and warm. Don't expect the Hilton but you're getting comfort and a good value. The location was ideal as it was walking distance to many attractions and public transport. The staff was very friendly and accommodating. Continental breakfast was not included but worth the 10 EUR as everything was fresh and of adequate quantity. Would stay here again and recommend!

Reviews.Title: “Great value in a fantastic location”
Reviews.Author: Bedminstergirl
Reviews.Content: My daughter and I stayed here for four nights. The Metro and bus stops were very close, I had forgotten the scale of the Paris maps! The location is very quiet, just off the Boulevard St. Germain in the Latin Quarter. We booked this Hotel because of the excellent reviews and we intended to be out for most of the day and evening, and did not need larger rooms or more facilities. We wanted to do as much walking as possible to visit the main sights close to the Hotel. This was very easy, despite the very cold weather. We found a couple of excellent Restaurants very close by, and opted for the A la Carte, rather that the Fixed Price Menus that were all very similar in the small pedestrian streets. Paris Hotel rooms in this price range are small, we have stayed in smaller! We booked a room on the 6th floor with twin beds, and no Balcony. It was one of the most expensive at 125 Euros a night, which we thought was fair. It was very clean, warm, and had a small Bath with shower. There is no lift to the top floor, the tiny lift only goes to the 5th floor, and then there is a circular staircase with an automatic lighting system that comes on when you trigger the sensor by going up the stairs. If you have mobility issues or are claustrophobic, then beware of the lift and the stairs. We had Breakfast every day there. The Dining Room is very small with seats squashed around very small tables. You can have Breakfast brought up to your room if you wish, a nice idea. However, the Hotel was quiet when we were there, so we ate downstairs. I had no intention of wandering around finding something cheaper than 10 Euros. You could eat as much as you wanted from Cereal, Cheese, Ham, good-quality Jams, Bread, Croissants, Pain au Chocolat, and Tea Coffee, and Herbal Teas. Drinks out were often at least 3-4 Euros, except from a roadside stall with a takeaway cup. Tea and Coffee was available from Reception 24 hours, for a small fee, as were beer and soft drinks from the fridge. Staff were helpful, and an Apple Mac was available free in the Phone Cubicle. My only negative comment would be that the landing corridors are rather shabby and somewhat neglected. The Lobby, small Lounge with TV, and Dining Roome have been nicely re-furbished. Our room was nice too. Reservation was very efficient, and my queries were dealt with very quickly. I looked at a local Best Western nearby, and it was more than 200 Euros a night. This charming Hotel is now on my list for another visit to Paris, it suits our requirements in every respect. Having found this little treasure, we shall certainly use it for a short break. We bought Carnet Tickets and pre-booked Museum tickets in the UK. It certainly saved a lot of time, and meant we could just get out and go! The ticket to Versailles bought from the Chateau on-line was excellent value, and we bought tickets that also included seeing the Dressage Practice Show in the Versailles Stables. The e-ticket office was shut when we arriived, but they were able to access my booking in the pre-paid ticket hall. All in all, we had a great trip with a busy itinerary all planned and booked 0n-l9ine.

Reviews.Title: “Small and Cozy”
Reviews.Author: gigiparis
Reviews.Content: When we first arrived for our 8 night stay, my husband mentioned that we might be able to get an upgrade if we asked the next morning. I laughed and let him know we were in the upgrade. We had a balcony. Highly recommend for breathing room as well as for a picnic with a view. We got used to moving in small steps and thoroughly enjoyed all this tiny hotel offered in the way of hospitality and location. The service at the front desk was superb and even the breakfast was a good value.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location, tiny room”
Reviews.Author: MAbdallah
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 4 night at that hotel. Its location is very central, right on St. Germain and a few minutes from St. Michel, walking distance to Notre Dame. My only negative comment on the hotel is the size of the room which was extra tiny with no space for our bags, and one window that was looking at the internals of the hotel so was completely dark. The furniture and bed linen was all red, which was abit too much.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, clean, reasonable...”
Reviews.Author: EnricoPallazzo55
Reviews.Content: Only stayed one night at Hotel du College on our way out of France but had a very good experience overall. We had sent an email indicating were arriving early just to be sure we could drop off our luggage for the day and were pleasantly surprised when they had a room ready for us when we got there. The room was decent, with a small balcony, the staff was friendly and helpful and the neighborhood is great - convenient to the metro and variety of reasonable restaurants nearby. Two thumbs up...

Reviews.Title: “Our stay was very comfortable, and the staff was very friendly!”
Reviews.Author: mkr-t
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here for 4 nights in Paris. It was a great location. There were subway stops right by us, and we were easily within walking distance of Notre Dame. It's a fun area of town, with lots of shops and restaurants. The staff was wonderful. Neither of us speaks French, but the dest staff spoke wonderful English, and were very helpful. They remembered us everytime we returned to the hotel. We even needed help with something at about midnight, and the man at the desk helped us right away and was very friendly. The rooms are very cute, and the bathrooms are quite roomy. The beds and pillows were comfortable and everything was very clean and well-kept. They held our luggage in a locked room when we arrived early, and had free wireless internet, which was great. I would stay there again in a heartbeat and tell all my friends to do the same. Also, we had a room with a balcony, and it was really cute. We enjoyed crepes on it!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderfull hotel and friendly staff in central location!”
Reviews.Author: Vendelbo
Reviews.Content: Me and my sister stayed at this hotel for 4 nights and loved this hotel! We had a twin balcony room and it was really cozy and nice! A beautifull balcony with a table and two chairs. The room itself had a okay bed a makeup area with a desk, safety box and a really nice bathroom with a bathtub and a good size!. The room was overall really great to the price and quite romantic if you are going as a couple. The staff and owners was very friendly and could talk english well and when you asked them for help or to order a taxi they where very welcoming! There was a small room/telephone box in the lobby area with a computer you could use for free for internet. And there was wireless internet. Breakfast was not included in the price but you could buy a nice breakfast for 10 euros or just go out in the latin quarter with its many nice restaurants for very cheap/fair prices. You can get a menu with 3 dishes for between 10 and 25 euros in all the restaurants in the latin quarter! The area was safe and very central and quiet as it was placed just a street away from the latin quarter! You could walk to the Notre Dame in 5 minutes and the Pantheon in 5-7 minutes. The latin quarter was 2-3 minutes walk from the hotel! There is metro just 2 minutes from the hotel in walking distance and at notre dame you can take the hop on hop off bus. Both me and my sister warmly recommend this hotel it is really great for the price compared to the other 4 hotels I have tried in Paris on some of my other stays and the location is so great!

Reviews.Title: “Good choice”
Reviews.Author: AllanFigueiredo
Reviews.Content: Good price, good location, good service, the only thing that could be better is the size of the bed.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel with a Lift”
Reviews.Author: JSmit201
Reviews.Content: What a gem! Excellent hotel for the money. 115 Euros per night in September 2010 for a room with bath. Beautifully decorated, the rooms are modern and roomy by European standards. The bathroom was huge and had a tub with massage shower. We even had a small balcony that we were able to have breakfast on. A small, wall-mounted flat screen tv had a couple English-speaking stations. There was also a safe in the room. Internet access is available in the lobby at no additional cost. Breakfast was tasty (croissants, assortment of cheeses, freshly squeezed juice) but cost an extra 10 euro per person. You're better off to pick up something from a cafe for that price. Imagine the surprise at finding a budget hotel with a lift! It is very small - only one person with luggage can fit. But who cares...after carrying luggage up and down metro stairs, a lift is as precious as gold! The hotel is located in the Latin Quarter off St. Germain. About a three minute walk to the metro (Maubert Mutualite is the stop) or the bus lines. Walking distance to Pantheon and if you're feeling energetic, can walk to Notre Dame & St. Chapelle. Overall, great location. I will definitely return to Hotel du College.

Reviews.Title: “Top hotel for location and price”
Reviews.Author: aussiemiss
Reviews.Content: I chose this hotel thanks to Tripavisor reviews, which were correct and my stay here for 8 nights in September 2010 was just wonderful. The price and location (5 minutes from the Notre Dame) are unbeatable. On top of that the room was a good size for a Parisian hotel and the hotel was very quiet, despite being a minute's walk from Blvd St. Germain. The beds were incredibly comfortable, the staff friendly and the 10 euro breakfast had a great selection. For these reasons I give it 5 stars. It was also near the bus stop and tube station and handy to the RER which goes to CDG airport. I highly recommend this hotel and would not hesitate to stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Little Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: mom-of-2-lovebugs
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at this hotel this past August while on vacation. We were a little apprehensive because the price was so reasonable for the location, but we really enjoyed our stay. The hotel is located in the Latin District, but on a side street, so it's not noisy. I loved being able to open up the windows and enjoy the breeze. The rooms do not have air conditioning, but they do have ceiling fans and also provide room fans. The rooms are incredibly clean, as are the bathrooms. There is a little vanity desk with a mirror and chair which was great when you have 2 people getting ready in the morning. The ONLY negative I have is that we did show up a day before our reservation and were given a room that looked into a concrete "courtyard" for one night. We would not have been as happy with our stay if we would have had to stay in that room. However, we asked to be moved to a different room for the rest of our stay and the staff kindly obliged. I would definitely recommend a stay here and would also stay here again myself!

Reviews.Title: “Cute Boutique Parisian Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Christophe01
Reviews.Content: On our first visit to paris we stayed at the Hilton Arc D'Triomphe and although it was a lovely spacious suite with a view of the tower it seemed remote from the heart of the city. But at this hotel we were very much in the middle of it all. The room was kind of small but opening the windows onto the street below made you forget that. The hotel is on a side street and has double paned windows so at night it was very quiet. The bathroom was very accomidating for a small room. We did not eat at the hotel restaurant but one need not look very far for good food in Paris. The neighborhood is replete with cafes and restauraunts as well as pattiseries, boulingeries, fromageries, wine shops and charcuteries. Across the street from the hotel is "Au Pre Verre" which served us one of the better meals of the trip; Suckling Pig in a White Sauce. Absolutely outstanding!! The hotel staff are very helpful and kind, and the price was good as well. We would definately stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Jean Marc and his wonderful staff make all guests feel like family.”
Reviews.Author: tripdreamer2
Reviews.Content: In planning this trip (along with my oldest female friend) I did lots of research on TA and elsewhere. Having both been separately to Paris before, we were ready to see some non-touristy quartiers, visit street markets near and far, and practice our limited French among real Parisions while keeping our headquarters "in the heart of it all ." Based on many great reviews, I selected Hotel du College. After spending seven nights there, I don't think I could be enticed to stay at a different hotel in the future. The location is perfect for exploring all of Paris: close to metro and bus stops on Blvd. St. Germaine, rue des Ecoles, and surrounding streets; just blocks from the Seine and Luxembourg Gardens. Jean Marc and his experienced staff provide a warm, safe, inviting atmosphere and treat every guest like family. While there, we met several travelers who have come back to this hotel year after year -- and we know why.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, affordable and convenient -- with friendly service!”
Reviews.Author: Kris_K_D
Reviews.Content: After several disappointing stays at other Left Bank "budget" hotels, I was cautious about booking a room in Paris. After much thought and consideration of TripAdvisor reviews of the Hotel du College de France, I booked a stay for two nights -- and was pleasantly surprised! We paid 110 Euros per night for a 5th floor double room with small balcony. The room and bathroom (with shower) are definitely small, but not as small as other budget rooms (namely compared to those in the Rick Steves-recommended hotels in the Rue Cler area... you know which ones I mean). The room was clean, comfortable and had two doors to the balcony, which contained a small table and two chairs. There was a closet with mirrored doors, and a desk with chair and stool. There was free and convenient Wi-Fi in the room, as well as a computer for internet access on the ground floor. The carpet was a bit worn, but that is the only complaint I MIGHT have. Otherwise, the room and hotel overall were VERY clean. To top it off, the service was warm and friendly, something I have not experienced in other affordable hotels in Paris. (And I say this with the utmost respect for Parisians; I know they have hard exteriors, but are truly nice underneath.) Day reception, in particular, was exceptionally helpful and pleasant, as were the cleaning staff and the woman who worked the breakfast buffet. The Hotel du College de France's Left Bank location puts it very near the Sorbonne, Luxembourg Gardens and Notre Dame, as well as making it an affordable alternative location to Right Bank walking distance visits to the Louvre and Rue Saint-Honore shopping. It's on a quiet street, but near to busy Blvd St-Germain. It is a hidden gem worthy of mention in guidebooks and on forums as an affordable Parisian hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, clean, comfortable, reasonably priced”
Reviews.Author: Shahama1
Reviews.Content: My husband, adult daughter and I stayed one night at this hotel in transit between destinations. Since we had less than two days in Paris I was looking for a location that would allow us to make the best of our time there. This was perfect. We arrived very early and checked out early the next day and the staff was very tolerant of the enormous amount of our luggage in their little office. The room itself was pleasant and the bathroom well renovated, shiney and roomy. The price of the room was quite reasonable but I think 20 Euros for a roll away was a bit much especially since it was of a poor quality and came apart. I did not tell the hotel about it until the next day and they immediately made note. Had I asked I have no doubt they would have changed it. The room was very crowded with 7 pieces of lugguage but we managed somehow. For two people with less luggage the room size would have been quite acceptable. I do appreciate them allowing us to even have the roll away as some places would have forced us to take a second or more expensive room. For one night, just to sleep it was quite sufficient. I regret not taking their breakfast for 10 Euros. The breakfast prices in the immediate surroundings were not much less and the convenience, time saved, and likely quality would have been worth it. In the evening due to jet lag we made an unfortunate choice in restaurants on nearby St Germaine called something like 24/7. The next day on our way to the walking tour we discovered a huge number of nice looking restaurants in the area of Saint Michel including Chez Clement a chain which we enjoyed a branch of last year near the Opera. So do your homework restaurant wise there is more than enough to choose from. I would return with pleasure!!! Thank you Mr. Sadr for all your help. The night guy and cleaning people were also very nice. Mr. Sadr also ordered a sweet taxi driver named Rachel who charged us a reasonable rate to the airport (tel. 0660486501).

Reviews.Title: “Great value”
Reviews.Author: kel3120
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at this hotel in mid-September. We arrived on the Thalys and took the RER train to St. Michel. It was just a short walk from there. The room wasn't ready, but they were able to store our bags. Once we returned, we were told that we had been upgraded from the double balcony room we had booked to the room with the Eiffel Tower view (room 63). To get to this room, you need to take the elevator up to floor 5 and take the stairs to floor six. We were pleasantly surprised with our room. It was very spacious with a wrap around balcony. A small table and chairs were set up in the area where the Eiffel Tower could be seen. It was a great place to sit, especially in the evening to watch the tower lit up. Although this was a really nice room to have with the upgrade, I would think twice about paying extra for this room since the Eiffel Tower is such pretty far away. If space is worth it to you, it may be worth the extra money. It was a nice touch that they included a binder with information on both the hotel and surrounding area (bakeries, wine shops, etc.). The free wifi worked fine in our room. The bathroom was also spacious and clean. Breakfast was 10 euro. We paid for this on two mornings because of the ease.
