One morning we did try to find something in the area that would be quick for breakfast, but after leaving the hotel, nothing was open other than sit-down cafes (8:00am). The subway location (St. Michel/Notre Dame) was great because it didn't require transferring to get to Gard du Nord (high speed train), Versailles, Orsay, and the Eiffel Tower. Also, the close proximity to Notre Dame and our Seine River cruise was convenient. This charming hotel is highy recommended!

Reviews.Title: “surprised”
Reviews.Author: veroesco
Reviews.Content: I did not know what to expect, i thought the price was to good to be true. But when i arrived and checked in i was extremely happy, My bedroom was quite big for a solo traveler (only 90 euros a night) and the bathroom was the perfect size. I loved how my room had a vanity mirror so i was able to sit and do what girls do brush my hair and put my make up on (while getting ready in the morning i would have the flat screen TV on CNN... while drinking my coffee....so happy). I was in room 44 next to the elevator i was worried i would not be able to sleep because of the noise. My room was so quite that at times i over slept because my bed was so comfortable. The staff is amazing and extremely helpful and trust me i ask a lot of questions. The Hotel is in the perfect location for walking distance to sights and shopping. I did not feel like A tourist where the hotel was located it was in a great ,quite, and safe area of Paris. from CDG airoport i took the R train and got off Norte Dame and walked only 5 min to the hotel as soon as you get off the metro and walk up the stairs you see Norte Dame, yup great way to start your day in Paris:) Last time i was Paris I stayed in Hotel Amour, i will only come back now to Hotel De College. I am still amazed how some reviews gave this hotel a poor rating. I honestly believe this hotel is a hidden treasure.

Reviews.Title: “Adorable, perfect hotel in Paris”
Reviews.Author: LisaVanValkenburg
Reviews.Content: My mom and I stayed at Hotel du College de France for 5 nights and wanted to stay more. The location is perfect. It's on a quiet street, yet it's only a couple of blocks away from the Siene and all the sites. The stairs are something to get used to, but you can always use the elevator. They have a nice Mac computer to use the internet, which was so wonderful to keep in touch with family. We didn't need much 'service' from the front desk as we knew exactly what we wanted to do while we were there, so we didn't ask for help in that respect. The bathroom wasn't perfectly clean, but the water pressure and temperature was great. Plus when I commented about the bathroom, they responded very quickly. We had a very small room (typical of Europe) but it was comfortable and the windows made it seem larger. Beautiful, long windows that made it seem like the entire room was a terrace. We would definitely stay here again - no doubt about it. And at 105 euros/night, pretty good deal. We had their breakfast only on the last morning as it was 10 euros/person.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel - top location & very quiet!”
Reviews.Author: SylvF
Reviews.Content: I stayed at HDCF for 3 nights in August with my partner, all I can really say that this is a hidden gem within Paris. The location of the hotel is fantastic as its within a few minutes walk from some of the main attractions, the metro and other tourist buses. The actual hotel is located about one block from the main road hence you get great sleep at night. The hotel staff were great and friendly, the rooms were small (the city of Paris was built how long ago??) but comfortable offering great views from the balconies. Definately will stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “An excellent boutique hotel!”
Reviews.Author: QSu800
Reviews.Content: I stayed at HCDF in early September. I was travelling on my own and I found that not only were the staff very helpful and friendly at the hotel, the hotel itself was in an ideal location for easy access to many attractions. After initially rejecting the first room that I was offered (on the first floor by reception, the kitchen and the dining area) they offered me one on the 6th floor. It was perfect for me - quiet, clean; and if I looked out of my window to the right I could even see the top of the Eiffel Tower! As for accessing local and other attractions and getting around, it couldn't have been easier for me from this hotel, located on the Left Bank in the Latin Quarter. Merci, all of you - I would most certainly stay here again!!!

Reviews.Title: “They dont honor reservations”
Reviews.Author: mserra
Reviews.Content: I made a reservation of a room that showed availble and they declined the reservation with no explanation whatsoever. Not serious.

Reviews.Title: “Still Great”
Reviews.Author: Peachgone
Reviews.Content: This was our second time at Hotel du College de France. First time was four years ago with the family and this time it was for a single night in Paris for my wife and I en route to the Pyrenees for le Tour. The service was great in 2006 and is probably even better now - the team at the front desk know how to get around and what to see. The location is great and the place is very easy to find when taking the RER from CDG airport. Nice and central with metro very close and five minutes to the Seine and Notre Dame. Rooms are small - but who lives in the room in Paris. Bathrooms are spotless and well appointed and the beds comfortable. We didn't have a great view from the room this time but for the one night we couldn't do better - we'll be back again!!

Reviews.Title: “Charming hotel in a great neighborhood for a reasonable price.”
Reviews.Author: jeanbobean
Reviews.Content: The hotel is located near the corner of Boulevard St. Germain and Rue St. Jacques, on the Left Bank. It is a great neighborhood, the hotel's rooms are cozy and clean and the staff is friendly and efficient. We've stayed there twice and were very pleased with the experience both times.

Reviews.Title: “epitome of paris”
Reviews.Author: frances2609
Reviews.Content: The price you pay a night for this hotel was definitely worth it for us who were traveling on a budget. The rooms might be a bit small for some but for us it just enough to move around even if you have a lot of bags. There was a TV, small wardrobe and bathroom with shower and toilet and free WI-FI internet which we were so great-full for. The rooms were cleaned everyday so we knew that the general upkeep of the place was consistent, it felt like we were coming home to a relaxing space after a days worth of travel! The hotel also offers plenty of services like buffet breakfast for 10 euros (which we did find a bit pricey so instead we walked around the local area to find something cheaper), restaurant recommendations and they can even call a taxi for you after you stay in Paris! The people there were friendly and spoke English very well so I'm sure if you need to ask anything they would be glad to help you out. What we liked the most is the location, 5 min walk from the Notre Dame Cathedral, 10 min walk to the Pantheon and the Luxembourg gardens, plenty of restaurants and cafes to suit every budget. Make sure to walk around just to experience Paris apart from the typical tourists stuff. However this is a two-star hotel so don't expect a grand lobby and room service. It was very simple and its exterior steered away from the typical western hotels, it had a very Parisian feel to it, we loved it this way! Overall our stay in Paris was made even better by staying in a great hotel, plus some of the staff were incredibly good looking.

Reviews.Title: “Great Little Hotel in a Great Location”
Reviews.Author: acstewart25
Reviews.Content: Other reviews pretty much sum it up - great location, very helpful staff, good breakfast (15 Euros which we had every day of our stay), laptop for guest use etc etc very good value for money. This was my first trip to Paris and I'm glad we booked this place, would stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Great value, charming hotel & perfect location!”
Reviews.Author: hellogoodbye_10
Reviews.Content: This hotel could'nt be located more perfect. Eventhough it was'nt close to the big sightseeing atractions, it was perfectly placed in a small, quiet street close to the metro. The rooms were satisfying - Clean, not to small and had everything you really need in a hotel. Breakfast was charming while you were seated in a small room with great atmosphere to chat to other tourists with their own recommendations of things to do. The service was amazing. They knew everything there was to know. Would go back every time visiting Paris in the future.

Reviews.Title: “This place was great! Guys at the front...”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This place was great! Guys at the front desk Always helpful. Computer with Internet access in the lobby and free wifi in the rooms. Close to the metro which is so dam easy to use!! Location wasn't so close to all the sites, 15min walk but we caught the metro everywhere. I travelled with my hubby and we loved it here! We the room with a balcony which was really cool to be able to sit on the verandah. There isn't any air con so if ur going in summer be prepared though there is a ceiling fan and a fan next to the bed that will help u through the night. Hygiene was perfect and I'm a clean freak! So that was good. We loved Paris over all.

Reviews.Title: “Nice and affordable hotel in Paris's most perfect location”
Reviews.Author: ThereGoesDeon
Reviews.Content: This hotel is an excellent combination between amazing value for money, pretty nice rooms and the best location in Paris. Just round the corner from the Sorbonne, you get all the loveliness of the Latin Quarter, which is easily my favourite part of Paris. The rooms are quite small, but perfectly clean and sufficient. Anyway, you're in the middle of Paris -- you're hardly going to spend your time in the room. Try to book room 53 -- it's on the corner and has a wonderful balcony with a table and a couple of chairs, from where you can look out over the street and enjoy a bottle of champagne. At about â‚¬100 a night, you can't do better than this hotel. I'll now stay here every time I go to Paris. (Assuming I don't somehow suddenly grow massively rich and start paying â‚¬400 a night for some boutique establishment.)

Reviews.Title: “Don't stay in room 16”
Reviews.Author: kkm7m
Reviews.Content: Maybe our room was the most "basic" in the hotel. Maybe the other rooms are better. Ours was a cramped dark dingy room which "looked" out onto a very unattractive dark dingy light well. No A/C. The only saving grace was the bathroom which was recently restored and was very grand and lovely. The staff were not all that helpful or friendly. The location was good and the price was good. Very easily accessible from/to metro. All in all, I think room #16 should be retired.

Reviews.Title: “Great Parisian Hotel-great value”
Reviews.Author: lucille0524
Reviews.Content: Wonderful location! Right in the middle of the Latin Quarter but on a quiet side street...a couple of minutes walk to Notre Dame. Clean, comfortable beds, great breakfast. We had the breakfast early one morning and the croissants were still warm-unbelievably good! The staff is very nice, friendly and helpful. A wonderful Parisian hotel at a reasonable price.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay in Paris”
Reviews.Author: DougCal
Reviews.Content: Hotel du College is ideally located in the Latin Quarter, and is modestly priced for Paris. The breakfast is typical French (fresh bread, cheese, ham, juice, cafe au lait, yogurt, fruit) and very good. The rooms are very clean and the bed is comfortable. The man at the desk was friendly and helpful. The elevator is very small - my wife and I barely fit in together with our two suitcases - the rooms are small, and the shower is very small. That did not bother us at all, it was adequate for our use and we did not spend much time in our room, but if you require a large living space a different (and more expensive) hotel might suit you better. We will definitely return to the Hotel du College on our next trip to Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Great location,great price!”
Reviews.Author: driver59
Reviews.Content: Just came back from stay here and just loved it. Great location in the heart of St-Germain room a bit small but not there to stay in room all day!!! Were there to go to the tennis matches so the metro nearby were a blessing and the line going directly there. Staff was polite and helpful if you needed information, use of computer is great,didn't have breakfast at hotel since there are many places around a bit less expensive. Did have dinner at restaurant just across the street "Au PrÃ©-Verre" simply excellent. Will be back for sure!

Reviews.Title: “Excelente Location. Really good prices.”
Reviews.Author: sylbanno
Reviews.Content: Have been in the hotel for times, it's my special hotel for paris trips. Really, really, good location, in the Quartier Latin, five minutes from Notre Damme. Excelent.

Reviews.Title: “A little gem”
Reviews.Author: GeoffLancashireUK
Reviews.Content: Booked this hotel for a 6 night break based on reviews in Trip Advisor and was not disappointed. Rooms are small (typical of Paris) but have everything you need and is spotlessly clean. Staff are helpful and friendly, even if you can't speak French though a little bit helps. Breakfasts are a little bit pricey but there are lots of other places nearby. The location is ideal for numerous cafes and restaurants and for viewing the sights of Paris. Looking forward to a return trip and would definitely book this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Small, friendly, quaint and in a great location, you couldn't ask for more.”
Reviews.Author: rita050
Reviews.Content: We stayed for eight days in March. Our room was small, but had everything we needed, including a very comfortable mattress. Bathroom was roomy enough and had a good shower and deep tub. M. Santana and all the hotel staff provided wonderful service, including a great chocolate for breakfast and ice for my bruised foot. Close to countless cafes, including the Metropolitan on St. Germain. Excellent high end restaurant across the street. Nearby fromagerie, boulangerie, and street market. We'd go back just to spend more time in the neighborhood! Could have used a comfy sitting chair in the room.

Reviews.Title: “This is our first choice for stays in Paris!”
Reviews.Author: Hotel_Reporter
Reviews.Content: Although this hotel offers breakfast; we did not eat here because there are so many wonderful places nearby. Our favorite was at the square â€œPlace de la Contrescarpe.â€� We would get a pastry or sandwich from Boulanger Patissier and have it with our cafÃ© at La Contrescarpe Restaurant. There are many students at this charming green area which has limited automobile traffic. Nearby, at 68 rue du Cardinal Lemoine, is GÃ©nÃ©rique. It isn't just a second-hand store (fripperie), it is instead a consignment shop (DÃ©pÃ´t-Vente). We wouldnâ€™t miss this place! It is a staple of our every trip to Paris. The hotel lobby is efficient and charming. There is a laptop which can be used if you forgot to bring your own (French keyboard). If you have one there is free WIFI available in the lobby as well as your room. The staff is very helpful with storing your luggage in the event that you arrive or leave either early or late. We stayed in room 54 and 55 (two separate occasions). We found that both were very nice. The bathroom area for 55 is more spacious. Both of these rooms have access to a private balcony area. There is a small table with two chairs that we enjoyed using for an evening meal. Because it was cool we brought the table inside the room, used a towel as a tablecloth and opened the windows to enjoy the view. It was charming! If you like to pick up a baguette, wine, fruit, cheese, and food, everything is conveniently available at Place Maubert. It is a very short walk from the hotel and the shops are located next to one other. The staff at the hotel provided the wine opener! The location is awesome â€“ easy access to all forms of public transportation. One quick train ride to CDG using RER B was economical and convenient. It was so quiet that we could sleep with the windows open allowing for fresh air. In summary, this will be our choice of hotels in Paris for the future. I only hesitate to share this information in that we wouldnâ€™t want to find it â€œcompletâ€� when we plan our return.

Reviews.Title: “What a steal!!!”
Reviews.Author: fliime
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 6 days from march 14-20th and what a great location, for value you can't beat this! Clean rooms, internet service, close to cafes and various restaurants, quiet street, room service every morning and helpful front desk. Why spend a fortune on a hotel when chances are you'll be walking around the city all day! Will be back for sure!

Reviews.Title: “Clean, great location, loved it here”
Reviews.Author: MP3Seattle
Reviews.Content: Fantastic location close to Metro, easy walk to Notre Dame. Maybe best of all it was also on a quiet side street -- better location than other nearby hotels on busy boulevards. Very clean. If anyone on this site complains that rooms and bathroom are small, they have just never been in Paris hotels. Compared to other places I've stayed in Paris, this was roomy! I had a standard double, with windows to outside street. Would definitely be happy to return here.

Reviews.Title: “Great Economy Hotel”
Reviews.Author: youngtraveler07
Reviews.Content: I was surprised at the earlier review from January....I just stayed in this little hotel a week ago and thought it was great! For the low price, yes, the room and bathroom were small, but they were clean and it was quiet. The staff was incredibly friendly to me and my friend and let me check in as soon as I arrived (very very early). They also let me leave my bags there during the day AFTER I checked out, which I also thought was very nice. If you are looking for a nice budget hotel with a great location, I would absolutely recommend Hotel du College de France.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic budget hotel”
Reviews.Author: squishymichy
Reviews.Content: This hotel is number one for location. It is a very short walking distance from all the major metro lines and most sights in Paris. There are fantastic surrounding restaurants and nightlife too. The rooms are simple but clean to a fault. The shower had hot water but was very small. We forwent the breakfast which we found pricey at 10 euros pp and instead ate wonderfully at a nearby cafe for 8 euros for the two of us. The room had a safe which was great, and the front desk staff were somewhat helpful. I would give this hotel 5 stars for what it is, but we were advertised free wifi and it was not working while we were there. Normally I would be understanding if they were trying to fix it but they made no effort that we could appreciate to do so. Overall a truly wonderful budget hotel and the best value in Paris. I would stay here again in a heartbeat.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for short break!”
Reviews.Author: TheIrishSlayer
Reviews.Content: Just finished a four day break with my fiancee. Chose this hotel after reading the positive reviews on websites googled and also those on tripadvisor. It's pretty much everything you'll read in the other reviews. We actually stayed in two different rooms which included the normal double room and also probably the best room in the hotel on the top floor (with the balcony and view of the Eiffel Tower). First thing to mention is that this is a hotel for those working within a budget. Paris is ridiculously expensive and you'll expect to pay double what you would pay in other cities around Europe. If you got the dough, you should probably stay somewhere else. I paid around 150 euros per night for the best room here. Got offered the No. 1 hotel on tripadvisor (Jays) for 250 Euros. If I had it, I would have paid the extra for what looks a beautiful hotel and rooms. But if you're an average earner like myself then I would say look no further! Getting there- Straight forward. We just grabbed the RER (train) from Charles de Gaulle airport, stopped at St Michel and walked the five minutes to hotel. Easy peasy. Location - Perfect! Right next to the Latin Quarter with plenty of restaurants, shops, bars etc. Lovely for an evening stroll etc. You are right next to Notre Dame Cathedral. Few minutes walk only. And yes, it is located on a quiet street yet so close to all the action. Walking distance from the main shopping area around the Pompidou Centre also. Price - very reasonable. I spent loads of time looking into alternatives and am satisfied this was an excellent deal. Rooms - First room we stayed in was a double with balcony on fifth floor. Pokey and small but clean. The second room we stayed in was room 62. Top floor. More spacious....satisfying more spacious and has a view of Eiffel Tower. The view is minimal and can only be seen from the balcony but fits the purpose of the old romantic idea of staying in a room with a view of the Eiffel Tower. Also had a bath and some matresses there that could be pulled out and used if there was more than two of you. Other info you should know- the lift is tiny so if you're a big boned person, to put it politely, then you'll find it a squeeze. We paid for the breakfast which I was satisfied with. Croissants, pain au chocolat, baguettes with ham and cheese, fruit salad, yoghurts, orange juice, generous jug of coffee or tea. Good enough to set you up for the day. Noticed some other female guest being sneaky and making some sandwiches which she wrapped up and took up to the bedroom before coming down again and having her breakfast. Obviously a means of a cheap lunch and not having to fork out the stupid prices they want in the cafes/restaurants. Paid twenty euros for a couple of crap crepes and coffees on the champs elysees to give you and indication of what to expect. The staff were all very nice and helpful too. Completely happy there too. So all in all, very happy. Had great weekend. Stay here!

Reviews.Title: “Spent 4 nights here with my boyfriend, and it was a perfect hotel.”
Reviews.Author: ariala
Reviews.Content: Pros: It has a great location in a quiet street in the Latin Quarter. There's a metro a few minutes away, and the walk to Notre is so quick. Lots of nice restaurants around (one right across the road) but doesn't seem to be smack in the middle of the touristy area of Latin Quarter either. The hotel's charming with wooden barges in the hallways and though the room's small it's certainly not cramped and was so clean. Staff were polite, friendly and always very helpful, free internet in the lobby. Cons: I can't make any complaint about the place! Our TV didn't work but then again we didn't inform the staff because we didn't care too much, I'm sure it would have been fixed if we had. Our view was of a wall and other rooms, but we didn't mind, so I'd say if you expect a view pay more for a room with a balcony.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: tnpatti
Reviews.Content: A friend and I just returned from three nights at this hotel. After spending a week in London at a 5-star hotel, there was a little culture shock at first. London had been so expensive, I chose the hotel because of the low price and good reviews - not for luxury. It is old with tiny rooms (two twin beds about an inch apart and about a foot on either side) and definitely not luxurious. However, in four days, I came to really appreciate it for it's cleanliness, great location, and helpful staff. Mr. Santana at the desk and the sweet little Italian maid were wonderful. We were allowed to check in at 9:30 in the morning which was so appreciated. The free computer worked better than the one at the 5 star hotel. I was most impressed by the fact that I walked around the room in socks, on carpet that had seen better days, and my socks were not dirty when I took them off.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely great”
Reviews.Author: alexander.
Reviews.Content: This was our seventh time staying at this wonderful truly French hotel. The owner and staff are responsive to your every need. The rooms are a great value as is the all you can eat breakfast. The street is quiet. Metro lines are close ,as is the Nortre Dame and other attractions. We stayed nine nights and wouldn't stay anywhere else.

Reviews.Title: “Quiet, great value”
Reviews.Author: oyvinfb
Reviews.Content: Very happy about our 3 nights at this hotel. Excellent location and yet very quiet. Not the most trendy place in the world, but a very charming and pleseant place.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent two-star hotel, welcoming staff”
Reviews.Author: BlueskiesN16
Reviews.Content: The hotel is in a great position, clean and quiet and the staff are friendly and helpful. Basically, you would struggle to find a better place to stay for these rates and the breakfast was very good value as well. Very impressed.

Reviews.Title: “Definitely a possible choice”
Reviews.Author: gbnet
Reviews.Content: I read several good reviews on trip advisor and I certainly I confirm the rating. Without being enthusiastic because the rooms are small and the beds even smaller. 10 â‚¬ for the breakfast are inappropriate given that you can have good breakfast at 7 â‚¬ just outside the hotel. No coffee maker machine in the room. Nevertheless, the position is absolutely fine, the hotel is clean, people are friendly and the price is competitive.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely, reasonably priced Paris hotel”
Reviews.Author: tapley
Reviews.Content: My husband and I had a very successful stay at this hotel. The room, while small by American standards, was big enough to accomodate us and our large suitcases, and still have room to move around. The location was quite good - easy walk to the Pantheon and Notre Dame, as well as the metro. The staff were very friendly and helpful and spoke English. Free wifi was a nice bonus, as was the elevator.

Reviews.Title: “Nice little hotel, great location”
Reviews.Author: DJT2007
Reviews.Content: The hotel was clean, staff friendly and it served our needs well (we stayed for 2 nights). We wanted a good location and good value and this is exactly what we got. The rooms are very small, but sufficient. Friendly service at the reception and also at breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel in great location”
Reviews.Author: wiscandsd
Reviews.Content: We stayed 6 nights in twin room 52. Room was small as expected, but more than adequate.Very clean and nice tiled bath with tub/shower. Clean towels each day if desired. Had a small balconey ,overlooking street, with small table & 2 chairs. Large window/doors gave lots of light and ventilation. Friendly staff. Excellent upscale restaurant across the street, LE-PREVIE , serving lunch &dinner. Reservations essential. Close to NOTRE DAME and lots of cafes etc. We walked in all areas of paris and felt we had the Best location AND hotel for the money [about 115 euros/nite] depending on room. Breakfast looked good, but we ate @ local Boulangerie.

Reviews.Title: “overall a good value”
Reviews.Author: carlop_oOo
Reviews.Content: This a good hotel with incredibly helpful and friendly staff. Rooms are nothing special, but they are clean and functional. There's a wi-fi free connection and the staff at the front desk are so kind to print your documents if you need to. The only problem we had was with our 4 beds room... upon arrival they told us that the prevoious guest had a problem so they gave us two twin rooms at the same price. I suspect that this was an excuse for a mistake... anyway they find us a solution (even if not very comfortable) and this is good.

Reviews.Title: “Fun location”
Reviews.Author: rskeen
Reviews.Content: This hotel has a lot going for it: 1) The rooms are small, but our room had 2 floor-to-ceiling windows that opened onto a balcony, which made the room feel more spacious and airy. 2) The service was friendly and helpful. 3) Most importantly (for us), the location was terrific. We were traveling with my 85-year-old mother, and we were able to find plenty to do in the vicinity and to venture out using the bus or metro. Despite being in a busy tourist area, the hotel is on a very quiet street. 4) The price is great, considering the location.

Reviews.Title: “Loved this little hotel”
Reviews.Author: marge333
Reviews.Content: My 19 year-old granddaughter and I stayed here and loved it. I must admit having been to Europe many times I expected small, but our twin room was TINY! Strangely, it did not take away from our enjoyment of our stay. We loved it...had fun looking out our little balcony windows and even though it was tight...they had a room safe, clean bath and comfy beds, nice breakfast and super location. It had ambiance and just the memory of it brings joy. Close to bus, metro, latin quarter, restaurants, shops, etc. Nice little church in the Latin quarter with interesting gargoyles and history. Easy walking distance to Notre Dame, latin quarter, and gorgeous architecture along the way. Felt very safe walking around at night. I would stay again in a heartbeat and recommend it to anyone for the price. It was perfect for us.

Reviews.Title: “Latin Quarter Charm, Location and Value”
Reviews.Author: He's Anonymous
Reviews.Content: One of the delights of Paris is its variety of small hotels with charm and character. Hotel du College de France is among the best. The decor is reminiscent of the Musee de Cluny, located a block away. The service is friendly and helpful. The rooms are small, but immaculate and with modern baths. The rates can't be beat. The Latin Quarter is a bustling part of town and the hotel is close to all the action, yet located on a quiet street. However, you can get a better breakfast at a better price at one of the many cafes within a block or so in just about any direction. For a great dinner, try Le Lre Verre restaurant, located just accross the street.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, reasonably priced, my Paris hotel”
Reviews.Author: CalifGirlie
Reviews.Content: This is the hotel my brother and I always stay when we go to Paris which is typically every few years. It is in a great location, super quiet street, right near the Metro and everything you want to see. The price is great, which in Paris, is hard to find. It is clean with small rooms, no frills. I always recommend this hotel to friends who are going to Paris and want something reasonably priced and conveniently located. If

Reviews.Title: “A little Gem”
Reviews.Author: OALEWIS
Reviews.Content: I cannot recommend this hotel enough. It's in the best location, its comfortable and clean and the staff are nice. It's great value for money and it's on a quiet street. The rooms are lovely and I stay here any time I go to Paris. It really is a little gem!

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay in the Latin Quarter”
Reviews.Author: jean4096
Reviews.Content: We loved having a small balcony. The room was much smaller than any we've stayed in. We thought the lack of A/C would be a problem, but with the fans, it was comfortable. The staff were great.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location and value for money”
Reviews.Author: pammyjeanNewZealand
Reviews.Content: My partner and I stayed at Hotel du College for five nights at the end of June beginning of July. The location couldnt be better, two minutes walk to Notre dam, Seine River, cafes, and restaurants. You are amongst the action here, but the hotel is in a quiet street so not at all noisy. The room was small but clean and comfortable and we opted for a balcony which made the room more spacious. The hotel staff were friendly and helpful and spoke good English. We would definitely stay here again if we came to Paris, very affordable and excellent value for money.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous and affordable hotel in the heart of Paris, France”
Reviews.Author: 5-Danes
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel in the beginning of july with our 3 children. They provided the optimal room solution for our family: two connected rooms with our own entrance. The childrens room had two twin beds + one extra bed. Our room had a double bed. The rooms are not big, but they are very nice decorated and very clean. There are safes in the rooms (no extra charge), tv and nice clean bathrooms. We found the staff very polite, forthcoming and helpful during the whole stay. The breakfast is served in a very intimate and family-like atmosphere, in a small, but cosy breakfast room. It costs 10 Euro, but we found it cheap compaired to local cafes, and considering that you could eat and drink all you want. The location is super, near to all the sights in Paris! When we visit Paris again - this is our hotel. We would recommend to all! Choose this hotel if you want a cosy atmosphere, super location and a great price.

Reviews.Title: “Book in advance”
Reviews.Author: Carlos23
Reviews.Content: Just a quick tip on this hotel, I tried to book 3 months in advance for a week in Sept.09 and it was already packed. Can't really say much about it or rank services but at least this I know (now!) . Good luck.

Reviews.Title: “Great find”
Reviews.Author: jhoppe
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel with my husband, sister and borther-in-law. It is a great find in the heart of the Latin corner for very little by Paris standards. I have travelled to Paris a number of times and this is by far the best budget hotel. Very clean rooms - not huge but spacious enough with a nice bathroom (we stayed in a double room with a bathroom and balcony on the fifth floor). Free internet access and Sat TV. We only had breakfast at the hotel once but it was outstanding for a European hotel - I have had worse in 4 star hotels! The staff are friendly and helpful - they kept our bags for us for more than 6 hours on the last day. It is also close to all the big sights and a short walk away from the Seine and the Metro. You won't do better for this price.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, comfortable, convenient.”
Reviews.Author: NYCNative1999
Reviews.Content: Room: Though the room was small by American standards, it was very clean (our #1 priority). We requested a room with a balcony and we enjoyed it very much. Yes, the room doesn't have AC, but the large windows more than sufficed. Noise: Other reviews have mentioned the noise, but it didn't bother us at all. One should expect *some* noise in an old building (read: no steel, concrete, double-paned windows) in a big city. Location: The hotel was a stone's throw from several metro stations and all the major sites. Touristy and not neighborhood-y at all. Service: The hotel provided car service to CDG as our return flight was at 7:15am for 60E. Very convenient.

Reviews.Title: “Screwed up reservation”
Reviews.Author: Hinkochi
Reviews.Content: We requested a room with a large bed and a roll-away for our 10-year-old child. Despite the fact that we had the e-mails printed out as proof of our reservation, they did not have the room available for us as promised. Beware of this hotel... You may not have a place to stay upon arrival. The man at the front desk read the e-mails and basically said sorry, but we're not going to do anything for you. They gave us a room with 2 small beds and a roll-away and did NOT offer us a discount for their mistake. The hotel is in the city, so not quite... Bring your earplugs. The rooms are ultra small, but clean. The decor is shabby and quite dated, but functional.

Reviews.Title: “Charming place to stay in a great location”
Reviews.Author: haligonian_trekker
Reviews.Content: My husband and I were looking for a reasonably priced place to stay in Paris, and came across this hotel. I would recommend this place for anyone traveling on a budget. It's clean, has a great atmosphere, and is in a wonderfully central location. If you plan to spend a lot of time walking around Paris, it's very convenient because you can pop back to the hotel for a break if need be, and then keep on going.

Reviews.Title: “Nice neighborhood, friendly service, quiet”
Reviews.Author: EdnaDurango209
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed 3 nights in a twin balcony room on the 5th floor. My mother and 18 year old niece were in a twin on the 2nd floor, no balcony. The rooms were very small, but it didn't really matter since we were in Paris to see the city and were there only to sleep. The balcony room was a nice bonus, though. We went to a local market and picked up some wine, cheese, and bread and sat out on the balcony in the evening. It was wonderful. Front desk staff was pleasant and helpful, providing directions, etc. The hotel had a certain charm about it and we enjoyed our stay. Everything was clean and in working order. The housekeeping staff was very friendly and pleasant. There is free wi-fi in the lobby. They serve European breakfast in the morning but it is pretty expensive at 10 euros per person, unless you are really, really hungry! The balcony had a small table with 2 chairs and there were 2 sets of french doors opening onto it. Plenty of ventilation, and there was also a ceiling fan. It was very hot weather on our visit, but we kept cool and comfortable at night, even without air conditioning. Very small, slow elevator, but no big deal to pop up and down the stairs (when you don't have suitcases). If you are used to staying at the Ritz, this is not the hotel for you. We took the train from London to Gare du Nord, and from there we caught an RER train, rode it for 2 stops, and walked 3 short blocks to the hotel. Pretty easy, except for the hassles of buying tickets at Gare du Nord. My advice on that is to bring exact change or an ATM card so you can find a ticket vending machine that works (sort of) to buy tickets. We found an awesome little bistro (Bistrot Le Saint Jacques, 71 rue St. Jacques) around the corner that specializes in Parisian food. In particular, galettes, which are thin buckwheat crepes grilled and filled with your choice of fillings. We had ham & cheese. Yum! It is a family owned and run business. The proprietor, Marc, was so gracious and welcoming. We met his wife, and sons. Even though we don't speak French, we communicated in a common language, Spanish! We felt like family members and we got to experience the "real" Paris. Unforgettable. Another tip: In this neighborhood, the Cafe Americain (coffee) is a lot better and cheaper at McDonald's than at Starbucks.

Reviews.Title: “Just what we wanted!”
Reviews.Author: cmw10
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for one weekend in a double room without a balcony (though it had beautiful windows). The room was simple but very comfortable and clean and the location was perfect. Our favourite lunch spot was right across the street at Pre Verre. The price was slightly more than we might have wanted to spend (104 euros) but we were very satisfied with the hotel. A definite recommendation!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for Paris”
Reviews.Author: teamcassidy
Reviews.Content: Great, clean, comfortable place. Stayed on the 3rd floor, corner room. Hoteliers were charming, helpful and friendly and available 24/7. In the middle of Latin Quarter. Five minutes walk to Metro, Seine, Notre Dame, great shops. Ten minute walk to Ile St. Louis, Rue Mouffetard. 15 minute walk to Marais, and St. Germain's cafes/shops. You would be hard-pressed to find a better spot for jumping off for adventures. It was our first time in Paris and our amazing adventure was definitely enhanced by Hotel du College. Couldn't recommend it more highly.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel in terms of price and quality”
Reviews.Author: jennikup
Reviews.Content: IÂ´ve really got nothing new to say, but iÂ´ll say this: - excellent location - rooms are very tidy, but a bit old-fashioned and tacky - pricey breakfast - people in reception spoke very good english and were pretty helpful too - free Internet connection downstairs! - I recommend highly restaurant Le Petit Prince (12, rue de Lanneau) nearby

Reviews.Title: “Gem of an hotel”
Reviews.Author: Tunku41
Reviews.Content: Excellent location, close to two Metro stations and RER, easy walking distance of Concergerie (Saint Chapelle), Notre Dame, Ile Saint Louis, Pantheon etc and relatively easy walk to Louvre, Les Halles, Musee d'Orsay and further, but also easy access to Metro, RER, main stations and bus routes (e.g. direct to Champs de Mars and Eiffel Tower), all of which we used. We stayed for a week and enjoyed our stay very much. Rooms were possibly a little small but more than suitable and very comfortable. Staff were friendly and helpful and spoke good English when our French failed (quite often!). Booked via internet and EMail with rapid response and confirmation from hotel and with no difficulty. Buffet breakfast was good and good value for Paris. Many good restaurants within easy walk. Area alittle more noisy than we expected but it was the Paris Jazz Festival at the weekend! Highly recommended and would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “All around great hotel in an excellent location”
Reviews.Author: mrjmann
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the Hotel du College de France for our honeymoon and were very pleased with all aspects of our time there. The room was small but comfortable and our balcony was a great place to sit and relax at night after a long day of walking (or for eating chocolate pastries in the morning). Also, the hotel staff was extremely courteous and accomodating (fyi: if you forget to bring an electronic plug convertor they will be able to provide you one to borrow, which is handy). Making the room reservations was an easy process as well, although the booking website doesn't show what rooms are available when browsing the page. Just make sure to reserve well in advance as the hotel was completely booked up during the whole time I stayed there. All in all, a great hotel in a beautiful part of the city.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value and ideal location”
Reviews.Author: LondonBritannia
Reviews.Content: A very comfortable, well appointed small hotel within easy reach of many tourist attractions and a good variety of restaurants. The management was very friendly & relaxed (instant provision of ice for essential room GnTs) but highly efficient. Would make it first choice for future stay.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Location for Paris in the Latin Quarter”
Reviews.Author: uribes
Reviews.Content: We just got back from our trip to France. As always I used Trip Advisor for our hotel selection. This hotel is perfectly located. Can't say enough of it. First of all you can get to the hotel directly from the airport without changing trains.We felt that this was great... The hotel is at walking distance from Notre Dame and the Seine river. We walked from our hotel to the Louvre and champs Elyses. Walked almost everyhere except for the Eiffel Tower, for this we took the metro and Bateax-Bus on the Seine. The Patheon and the Sorbone are blocks away. There are cafes and restaurants all over the Latin Quater and St Germain. You really feel like a Parisian since the area is full of locals and students. The hotel is very clean, the room was small but confortable. The bed sheets and pillows were of great quality. We chose not to have breakfast and went to the cafes and bakeries in the neighborhood. Their free wireless internet service was a plus. I had been to Paris before and stayed close to the Opera and Madelaine. Those neighborhoods might be more upscale but I feel that they lack the Parisian feeling. I will choose this hotel again or another one in the area when we come back.

Reviews.Title: “Superb Location, Clean & Friendly”
Reviews.Author: JackRoy
Reviews.Content: Lovely hotel about 4mins from Notre Dame to the North & the same from the Pantheon to the South, with two metro stations within 3mins walk. Because of its location you can easily get around walking to all the various central sites in Paris with ease and even areas further out (e.g. Sacre Cleur) on the metro. The hotel itself is nice, we didn't make breakfast but just around the corner at Maubert is a great bakery, deli & fruit shop where we got lunch/picnic items at a fraction of the cost of buying them ready made, plus they had much better produce. Also a market runs 3 times a week at the same place. The rooms themselves are spotless and functional but on the small side but that is common in Paris and especially in this type of hotel. All in all, an excellent base from which to tour around the sights, shops and museums in the city.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Mrsb918
Reviews.Content: We stayed in Paris for one night, and we were so happy with this hotel choice. It is a great location - just few minutes walk from the Metro station and the Notre Dame Cathedral. And, it was close to great restaurants that are not overrun with tourists. The room was small, but very normal for a European hotel. We had a great balcony overlooking a quiet street. And, free wi-fi in your room!

Reviews.Title: “This is a great small hotel”
Reviews.Author: Hermiedog
Reviews.Content: The lobby is beautiful, the front desk staff are not only helpful but all have a sense of humor, the breakfast room is beautifully decorated and they offer a wonderful breakfast of fresh croissants/baguettes/pan au chocolat, cheese, yogurt, cereals, and a bowl of FRESH fruit every morning. Not to mention the best -- a big pot of steaming coffee with a big pot of steaming milk. We had a wondefful stay. The hotel location is very near the Sorbonne, just off the Rue St. Germain and a short walk to the River. We would give this hotel the highest recommendation and will definitely stay there next time. Also, free internet access in the lobby.

Reviews.Title: “Clean,convenient & cosy.”
Reviews.Author: darrellhilton
Reviews.Content: Agree with the reviews here. Good location, very clean, & reasonably priced for Paris. Rooms quite small but suspect this is par for the course in Paris. Recommended.

Reviews.Title: “The Best!”
Reviews.Author: rocklady
Reviews.Content: We met our son in Paris so we had a double and our son had a single.(We had a chance to see 2 different rooms!) Both rooms were very comfortable, had hairdryers, good size newly remodeled bathrooms. We had a room (#43) with 2 windows overlooking the street, simply charming - no problem with street noise. The hotel's location was close to metro, lots of restaurants, and tourist sights. If you come by train, the metro is in the same station. It's an easy 20 min ride to the hotel. Beware: a cab will cost 20-25 euros from the train station vs 2 euro for the metro. The hotel is located in the Latin quarters - Paris is a walking city and this is the best starting point. Mr. Santa Ana was very cordial very helpful (from our email communication while we were in teh states to the courtesies that he extended to use while we were there) and was able to loan us a converter that we forgot to bring. Breakfast is served at the hotel. I think it was 10 euros, but there are bakeries nearby and farmers markets on the weekend for tasty breads, sweet roll, and delicious cheeses. Simply wonderful. We can say enough about this hotel. We would definitely come back and stay here!

Reviews.Title: “HCF - Great Hotel, Great Price, Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Cydspal
Reviews.Content: As a family of 4, we stayed 3 nights and were very happy with this choice! Very nice area, easy metro and RER access. Clean room, nice staff! Bottom line for this review: If we return to Paris we would stay here!

Reviews.Title: “A Fine Choice in the Latin Quarter”
Reviews.Author: BrynMawrBK
Reviews.Content: I stayed here with my two children, aged 20 and 11, in late March 2009 and was very pleased. The hotel is located on a very quiet street adjacent to major avenues filled with shops and restaurants, so it's easy to walk to many places and is close to tourist sites such as Notre Dame, the Cluny Museum, and several of the historic Left Bank churches. The hotel is quite basic but very clean. We had a small triple room on the 6th floor, furnished very simply (think Motel 6-ish but with slightly more charm). Unfortunately, the elevator (which is only large enough for one person plus one or two medium suitcases) only goes to the 5th floor, and as there is no help with bags we had a rather scary time dragging three heavy suitcases up the narrow spiral staircase to our floor. Note also that there is no shower curtain in the bathtub, so if you're not careful with the shower hose you'll have a very wet bathroom! Even so, my kids especially loved the hotel, and we had a nice view of the adjoining rooftops. The front desk help was pleasant. They have a good list of recommended restaurants within a few minutes' walk, and agreed to help me make a reservation if I needed. On the whole, you can't beat this place for the price (102 Euros/night for a triple) given its location. I would definitely recommend it for bargain accommodations.

Reviews.Title: “2nd time back--Great value, nice staff and perfect location!”
Reviews.Author: Sunnyshine
Reviews.Content: This is our second time back to the Hotel du College and we continue to come back for the great value, and great location. The rooms are kept sparkling clean. This is not a super plush hotel, and the rooms do look a little dated, but we don't mind. It is really the type of place you wish they had in all great cities--10 minutes walking to Notre Dame and close to anywhere you want to be on the right bank or left bank in Paris. Highly recommend it to anyone looking for a great value stay in Paris. ps. They have free high speed Wifi at the hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Clean, friendly, ideal location!”
Reviews.Author: 2plus2NEEngland
Reviews.Content: Travelled with husband, son aged 10, and daughter who turned 14 during our stay. I emailed hotel before booking and they were able to accomodate us all in one room on ground floor, a comfortable double bed and two rollaway beds. Room was still big enough for us all, and bathroom spotlessly clean. Staff were pleasant and spoke better english than i speak french! We had breakfast each day of our stay and it was fine, ok not cheap but better than a crepe on a street corner and cheaper than many of the cafes. And now the best part of this hotel - LOCATION!! As mentioned in other reviews this hotel is situated on a quiet side street off the Boulevard St Germain, which is a bustling main street filled with cafes, bars, restaurants, take away food places, and trendy shops. Also close to metro station, and bus stop. Plus a 5-10 minute stroll and you're in front of Notre Dame. We couldn't have wished for a better hotel in a better place. Hope to visit again!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value”
Reviews.Author: AandSKB
Reviews.Content: All the most recent (2009) reviews say everything that needs to be said about the Hotel du College de France - it is an exceptional hotel for its location and price. We've only marked-down Rooms to 4* because the double beds are small (although we were aware of this before we arrived because the size was clearly stated on the booking form) and Service to 4* because we didn't need any so can't really rate it! What no one else has commented on (yet) is that the restaurant directly opposite - Le Pre Verre - is foodie heaven and well worth a visit, although you'll need to book ahead by 24 hours, at least, on Fridays/Saturdays. Their current 28.50E three-course menu is fantastic value for money for exquisite food - and what else are you in Paris for?

Reviews.Title: “Good central crashpad”
Reviews.Author: chib0
Reviews.Content: This is not your standard US hotel: no huge rooms size of football pitch, no bellhops, no trays with breakfast straight into your room, no fitness centre, no iron press, no coffee-maker in the room. But it's a good choice for Paris. Location is both central (Latin Q.) and quiet (on a small side street with no through traffic); the area appears safe (university neighbourhood). A short stroll to Notre Dame. RER/metro is 5 min walk away. Importantly, it's only 2 stops on RER (direct - no changes) to Gare du Nord, so very convenient for Eurostar. Many restaurants nearby, also a decent supermarket near the Metro (Monoprix). Rooms are on the small side, but decent enough for central Paris. We had our son with us and they managed to put a rollaway bed in a way that we could still move around the room. There was a little space for everything: a desk, a wardrobe, etc. The room looked a bit old, but still well-maintained. The bathroom was obviously recently renovated and sparkling clean. No fridge/minibar in the room but drinks and snacks available from reception. There is a ceiling and a floor fan, but no a/c - so I am not sure about being there in hot weather. In-room safe was another plus. Not too much noise, although we could hear the bathroom next door. Wifi is supposed to be free, but we could not get any access; there is a PC downstairs though. We did not try the breakfast as it seemed pointless to spend 10 euro per person on it with so many places to eat in Paris. Finally, the view from the room could be better (we were on the courtyard side, meaning no view - but also no no noise, and no bright sun), but in Paris you go elsewhere for the views than your hotel room. They only carry 2 stars above their entrance, but for 2 stars it was really solid quality.

Reviews.Title: “Very cosy, loved it.”
Reviews.Author: skattieSitka
Reviews.Content: I read reviews on TripAdvisor before I decided to make a reservation with this hotel. It got good reviews, and I was not disappointed. The front desk staff were very friendly, and my room was small, but very clean. I loved the tiled bathroom. I only stayed for 3 nights. I had breakfast one morning for 10 euros, and was quite happy with the delicious croissants, coffee, cheese and ham, various cereals, yogurt, and juice. The location is great. Close to the Notre Dame, Les Halles shopping mall and many coffee shops and restaurants, atm's, small grocery store and a Pharmacy. It's a little bit of a walk to the Eiffel Tower and the Arc de Triomphe, but there is so much to see along the way that it's worth the walk. I felt very safe at this hotel, since I was traveling on my own. It was quiet as well, but then again I don't know how many people were staying at the hotel at the time, since it was beginning of February.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding Small Hotel”
Reviews.Author: JoeTravelDallas
Reviews.Content: i usually stay at the Grand Hotel Jeanne d'Arc in the Marais, but since they were fully booked, I gave the Hotel du College de France a try and now I'm a loyal fan. This place was incredibly charming and comfortable, and I've never had as friendly and welcoming a Front Desk in Paris as I had here. My room was quiet, clean and bright. The biggest surprise was the breakfast -- they actually serve meat, cheese, fruit and cereal-- a great value! Most places in Paris are lucky to serve you coffee and a roll. Again, I can't say enough about this place, and highly recommend it to anyone looking for a superior value in a fantastic location.

Reviews.Title: “excellent location and comfortable hotel”
Reviews.Author: teens1977
Reviews.Content: really lovely hotel, excellent price for central city hotel. Lovely area, close to all amenties - comfortable rooms, was lucky enough to have a balcony. Would definately stay there again, could not fault my stay.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel in Paris”
Reviews.Author: amybatt
Reviews.Content: This is a bit belated, but I wanted to give credit where it was due. After five trips to Paris, I have finally found a hotel I would return to again and again! HCdF has it all... 1) Room -- our twin room was huge by Paris standards. Plenty of room to have suitcases open and still walk around. Always clean, comfortable beds and linens. Nice, large bathroom. Our room was overlooking a street, but it was quiet enough that we slept with the window open and were not at all disturbed. No hallway or elevator noise at all. 2) Location -- Paris is a city to walk and this hotel is perfectly located. We are young walkers, so we were in front of Notre Dame in about 7 mins. The Cluny and Pantheon are under 5 mins away. We could walk to restaurants elsewhere or take advantage of the two nearby metro stops to zip somewhere else quickly. The Chatelet stop is about 8 mins walk, and that truly gets you anywhere on the metro quickly. In Paris a hotel's worth is truly all about location, location, location. HCdF had it for us. 3) Breakfast was 9E a day when we were there and very extensive. We took advantage of it to fuel our day because who doesn't love a nice cup of coffee and fresh pastries without leaving the hotel? Internet in the lobby in a phone booth was handy. Staff were extremely helpful and friendly. We had absolutely no complaints. I've stayed in the Marais, Trocadero, Rue Cler and Louvre/Rivoli areas before and none compared with this.

Reviews.Title: “A jewel among hotels”
Reviews.Author: CTJanet09
Reviews.Content: Having studied at La Sorbonne years ago, I love the Latin Quarter and prefer it to any other part of Paris. The hotel staff were, as other reviews have said, kind, welcoming and friendly. The location suited me perfectly, and the room was a bargain. The hotel is impeccably clean, the staff made the computer available to me and also told me where there were internet cafÃ©s. The breakfast allowed me to sally forth to museums and exhibitions directly from the hotel and the location was one that I felt secure in, traveling as an unaccompanied woman. Part of the appeal of this lovely refuge are the exposed beams which disclose a very old building, perhaps from the 18th century. This is a delightful place to stay, reminiscent of all the best that French hotels had years ago, but updated in terms of technology without having sacrificed charm. JM/CT, USA

Reviews.Title: “Great location, good value - would stay again”
Reviews.Author: framerican52309
Reviews.Content: We spent a tiny bit more than we planned, but it was beyond worth it. The hotel was located near so many sites - Notre Dame, City Hall, the Senate, Luxembourg Gardens, and within walking distance of the Louvre. It was also near metro stops and a train stop. Not to mention there were tons of restaurants nearby. Just ask the front desk where to go or walk around near Notre Dame for fast food type of stuff. The rooms were small, but not so small as to be a nuisance. They were very clean - no problems there whatsoever. There was enough room to not be tripping over your suitcases all week. (We stayed in two different rooms since we left mid-week for Normandy. They even let us leave behind one of our suitcases while we travelled! I was nervous but nothing went missing, etc.) We skipped the breakfast at the hotel. I believe it was 10 euros per person and we knew we could beat that price. One day we had a full breakfast for 18 euros and every other day we grabbed croissants & coffee for around 7 euros total. The hotel had free computer access, which came in very handy. It's located inside a little booth, so not the best set-up, but really no problem. It was a great help. They also posted the forecast every day. No real complaints about the staff. We met a gentleman named Bruno on our second to last night and wished we had met him sooner! It was a pleasure chatting with him!

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: upbeat624
Reviews.Content: Reasonably priced hotel by Paris standards and a wonderful central location to all the sights. Good restaurants nearby and we walked almost everywhere. The staff at the hotel were very accommodating -- we were travelling with three other couples and they were very patient giving us directions and suggestions. The rooms were small but clean. The breakfast was fine although costly. We would most certainly stay there again. We booked by email and it worked out just fine.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Location, Clean, and Inexpensive”
Reviews.Author: TinkerToyTess
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed four nights in the Hotel College du France in early December. The location is fantastic - within walking distance to many tourist destinations, and just minutes away from several subway stops. Our room (yes, it was small, but who goes to Paris to hang out in a hotel room??) was impeccably clean and comfortable, and I was impressed with the cleaning staff's daily attention to detail in making up our room - I'll admit that I'm pretty picky. Breakfast was nice - not the most fabulous I've had, but adequate and a convenient offering. The location and cost of this hotel make it just perfect for tourists who are looking for a decent place to stay without spending a fortune.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel in great location”
Reviews.Author: LondonTwiggy01
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel for 2 nights and didnt have one bad thing to say about it from beginning to end. I booked it through their website (and emails) they were very quick in responding with my queiries. It is within 3 mins walk from Maubert-Mutualite underground station but we walked to most places as it is so central-you can be infront of the notre dame within 5 mins. The check-in staff were always very polite and curteous to us helping us with any queiries. Having stayed in a few hotels in Paris i am well aware that rooms can be quite small and misleading however this one was different i was pleasantly suprised to see the size of our bedroom (room 32) and a large bathroom. It was clean, spacious and comfortable. We had view over the road, i am usually a light sleeper but didnt hear a thing al night. We had the breakfast at the hotel one morning, buffet style including bread, cheese, ham, cereal, jam, pain au chocolat, croissants etc. Waitress was also very polite. Check-out was again very simple, polite and friendly they even asked us how we had found our stay. If i came back to PAris i would not hesitate to stay here again, you will not find such a hotel in such a location at this price. Im sure it wont be long before the proces go up. There are also plenty of bars,restaurants in this area and you are 5 mins from the Latin quater and from Notre Dame.

Reviews.Title: “Great value for your money, great location, very friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: Viri_C
Reviews.Content: Great small hotel in the vecinity of the Latin Quarter. Clean quarters with great staff, from the front desk to the ladies that help at the "restaurant". Quiet and convenient....

Reviews.Title: “Latin Quarter”
Reviews.Author: Bjorkus
Reviews.Content: Pros: Charming Access to internet Clean Inexpensive Good location (10 min walk to Notre Dame) Cons: Noisy The walls are very thin and unfortunately our neighbors were quite noisy. You can also hear a lot of noise from outside even though we were on the 4th floor. If you're looking for a cute, clean, inexpensive hotel with a decent location, this one is an option. If you're picky about noise, I'd look elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “Another fine stay!”
Reviews.Author: mccarthy66
Reviews.Content: Just back from another fine stay at the College De France, our second. I've been telling my colleagues at work today about the warmth and good cheer that awaits all-comers! Everyone, from Mr Sadr (since 1982!) at the reception to the cleaning staff, are unfailingly polite and good-humoured. We stayed in a Superior Room this visit & it lived up to its title! Strongly recommended if available. All of the amenities are excellent from the free internet usage in the lobby to a fine big bathroom with bath tub and endless supplies of hot water. A fine breakfast was brought up to our room each morning within 5 minutes of being requested, & delivered with pleasantness and courtesy by the maid. We love the area! The Quartier Latin has a wonderful ambience and is perfect for wandering around. Many, many excellent restaurants (try Le Pre Verre opposite the hotel, but you must book in advance) and a great buzz in the cosmopolitan locale especially from the students of the Sorbonne. Finally, one small criticism: a maid knocked and woke us to come in & clean our bathroom in the mid to late afternoon despite a 'Do not disturb' sign being on the door. We had been out in the morning & thought the room had been done already. However, this is only a minor criticism, and we have booked again already for next year!

Reviews.Title: “The best little hotel in Paris you could wish for !”
Reviews.Author: Holidevil
Reviews.Content: We had booked our flight to Paris roughly 6 months ahead of our planned arrival date in mid-Sept. ' 08. We reserved our first 4 nights in the city at this hotel at the same time. Our decision was based on the many favourable reviews noticed on Tripadviser. We were not disappointed -- in fact we were surprised and "over-pleased", if you could imagine. The Hotel du College de France is a very clean, affordable, friendly hotel in a very convenient location to discover the centre of Paris. What more could the average tourist ask for ?! Once there, we asked for a reservation for our last 3 days in France prior to flying home a month later. At first there was no room -- we were approached later by staff to say there was a last minute cancellation for only 1 of the nights we wanted. We grabbed it without hesitation. So my point is, the secret is obviously out about this place. Book well in advance to avoid disappointment. The staff is great. Whenever we approached them with whatever request we had, it NEVER seemed to be a bother to satisfy us. All the top floor rooms had a little balcony & table it appeared. We were assigned room #23 which was the only lower room with a balcony setup and it was delightful. We often brought back store -bought food and drink to dine on our balcony. The store is very handy just down the block to St. Germain, cross the street then a quick left I best recall. There's also a 'pub-like' restareunt at that corner . It's one of the few places in France we could find to go for a ham & egg breakfast if you prefer that in the morning. If you are a strong walker you can reach most popular city attractions by foot from the hotel. There are other attractions that will require public transit use. The subway system is handy and efficient. The larger stations though are hectic and a little dis-orienting. We happened to meet so many helpful ordinary Parisians who were willing to stop and guide us when they noticed us looking dazed and confused on our journeys. Yes, Paris ( and France generally) to our delight ,can be discovered as being quite friendly !

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, Great Room, Great Location!”
Reviews.Author: yellowsteph
Reviews.Content: THE HOTEL'S WEBSITE: Booking the hotel online was very easy--the hotel's website is easy to use, and is offered in English, French and Japanese. My boyfriend and I stayed at this hotel all three (3) days we were in Paris, and it was great. The website offers great directions on how to get there from the airport, etc. LOCATION: This hotel's location is perfect--we were about a block away from two metro stops, a block away from the hustle and bustle of the latin district dining and shopping, two blocks from the Notre Dame, and two blocks from The Pantheon. We were able to take the metro or walk to all our Parisian destinations. The hotel is located on a quiet street, comparably. THE ROOM: The room was great--a double bed, TV, fan, bathroom & shower in the room, and french doors leading to a balcony. We stayed on the 5th floor, which offered beautiful views of a church and other nearby buildings. My favorite day was when we came back to the room, mid-day, and opened the balcony doors, let the sunlight and autumn breeses in, and took a nice nap. (-) The walls are thin, and we could hear the people in the room next to us, but it wasn't a big deal as our neighbors were not loud. BREAKFAST: We had the option of having breakfast on the first floor in the hotel, for 8 Euros each, each day. Breakfast was convenient and nice--consisted of choice of Coffee, Tea, or Hot Chocolate. Cereal, milk, fruit, yogurt, croissants, bread & cheese. (-) There are hotel rooms on the first floor. These rooms are right next to where people are eating breakfast, which might be loud for those guests staying in these 1st floor rooms. I would suggest requesting a room on any other floor, unless you're an early riser. HOTEL STAFF: Hotel staff, including front desk clerks, house-keeping, and one of two breakfast servers, were all very pleasant, smiling, and positive. (The other breakfast server was a little rough and blunt, but not "rude" nor "pleasant") I was especially impresse with the front desk clerks. They were always very pleasant and patient. MISC: The hotel is quite tall... 6 or 7 stories? There is a small elevator, or a spiral staircase to take you to and from your room.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in every way”
Reviews.Author: JudyAlexandria_MN
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a 5 night stay at the Hotel du College de France and couldn't have been happier. Found it on Fodors and also read trip advisor reviews. After staying in different areas of Paris, we decided to try the Latin Quarter. Great Location. Able to walk to many places and also had bus and metro close by. Asked for a twin room and had the one pictured in the website. Large bathroom, comfortable bed, good TV with CNN and BBC. Loved the internet too. All the people at the reception were friendly and helpful. We will definitely stay there again .

Reviews.Title: “Great 2 star Hotel”
Reviews.Author: MollyMacSporran
Reviews.Content: The location and friendliness of this hotel more than make up for any short comings, ie breakfast, small rooms etc. Very easy to get to and from the airport CDG as the RER stop is only 4 minutes walk away - a BIG bonus. We found it to be comfortable and clean and just so close to many excellent cafes and restaurants - especially recommend Le Pre Verre across the road (one of the best meals of my life) and the Vietnamese (Bonjour Vietnam) next to the Pantheon. Would not hesitate to stay here again and would gladly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect budget hotel”
Reviews.Author: ohmirose28
Reviews.Content: We booked our 5-night stay based on the reviews of other TripAdvisors and we were not disappointed. We, also, loved the location and friendly staff. We stayed in Room 16 for 99 euros a night, We agree with other reviewers that this room had no view at all and was on the warm side, but the ceiling fan made sleeping comfortable. Our bathroom with shower had been modernized, with plenty of hot water and towels. There was a small, inconveniently located closet and no dresser. If your suitcases are huge, you may have a problem storing them, as the room is on the small side. The big advantage to being on the floor above the lobby is you can use the stairs and don't have to always be waiting for the elevator. The lobby is really more like a cozy living room. The dining room is off the lobby toward the back of the building. For 10 euros you get cereal, juice, croissants, yogurt, coffee. A bit pricey, so we always ate our Continental breakfast elsewhere. Be sure to make reservations at least one day at Elle Pre Verre, directly across the street from the hotel. Wonderful meals, reasonably priced!!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent”
Reviews.Author: JLim
Reviews.Content: Very pleased with room (no. 10). Bathroom is spotless. Location is fantastic; 1 min walk to Metro stop & directly opposite is a fabulous restaurant which is highly rated in all the guides. Staff are unobtrusive but always polite & helpful. Free Wi-fi in room is a bonus! Didn't have breakfast at hotel, as so close to so many other great patisseries/cafes.

Reviews.Title: “Very clean & well located”
Reviews.Author: Porky113
Reviews.Content: We stayed here 3 nights and loved it. It was very clean and well located to most places. We walked almost every where, it took a bit of walking but we did it. The transit system runs right by the end of the street as well as the underground. I too found Marc to be very helpful. Our room was large enough compared to some rooms we have stayed in. Our breakfast was included in our price and was very good. We will returned and recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Great value and quality”
Reviews.Author: writer48
Reviews.Content: The location is wonderful, the staff helpful. They made recommendations for restaurants, called in our reservations, and made suggestions regarding places to see and do. (The jazz clubs are outstanding, but not as plentiful as we expected.)We had a rear-facing room and would have preferred a street-facing room, but the hotel was fully booked and it worked out well. The hotel is on a relatively quiet street between Boul. St. Germaine and the College de France. We have stayed in other hotels in this area, but would return to this one. The breakfast was ample and fresh and the staff (desk, kitchen and housekeeping) extremely courteous and friendly. There is a laptop on the first floor for free use. The rooms were clean and of decent size. We could have used more space for our clothing and luggage. The bath was sufficiently large and very clean. We highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel in 5th Arrondisment”
Reviews.Author: kipf2
Reviews.Content: Good hotel in 5th Arrondisment of Paris. Close to Notre Dame. Only a block of two from Metro station. Desk clerk Marc is very knowledgeable. Younger clerk not so much. Breakfast is not cheap, but is all-you-can-eat. I took my cue from French woman there, wrapped up hard roll or croissant and ham/cheese and saved it for lunch. Given the prices in Paris for lunch this was a bargain. The room was of adequate size, clean, and with a good bathroom. There is no A/C but this was not a problem in August with cooler temperatures. I had a corner room facing two streets. The neighborhood is quiest enough. Has an elevator (lift), small but helpful for getting luggage to room. All in all, a nice place to spend a couple of nights.

Reviews.Title: “Good time”
Reviews.Author: pssyko
Reviews.Content: Overall a very good hotel, great location near the metro was very useful. Can also walk to the Louvre and Notre Dame with no problems. Would recommend to a friend. Staff was helpful and speaks English well. Get a room on an upper floor as the street noise on the lower ones can be pretty loud, we were in room 43 which was fine.

Reviews.Title: “good enough but not excellent”
Reviews.Author: GiovanniPalermo
Reviews.Content: I was in Hotel college de france on July 2008. I had red all the excellent reviews on this hotel and so when I decided to spend five days in Paris I booked at once to "College de France". My experience is a bit disappointing: I had a little room to first floor; the window looked at the back side of the Hotel and it was a dirty, sad and disagreable panorama. The staff of the hotel was on average... The better thing is the location of the Hotel, just in the heart of Paris. The price was a very good price (99 euro for a triple room)...but attention: the third bed was not a real bed but a little roll camp-bed! my son of 10 years old could'nt sleep 'cause it was unconfortable and so, I was forced tu put him between me and my wife in our double bed (140 cm. X 3 persons!!!). Anyway: I advise this Hotel if you want to spend a little price and , by the way, if you want to stay in a wonderful location. Next time If I come back to Paris I think I go again to College the france but I'd like a room in an higher floor and with a real bed for the child!!!

Reviews.Title: “The reviews are true!”
Reviews.Author: juanita58
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 3 nights in late July. Everything good said about it on previous reviews is true. Great location, you can walk everywhere! We had room #52 with twin beds and a balcony with two sets of french doors (windows). 107 euros per night. There was a bit of noise one night but we walked so much during the day that falling asleep was not an issue. Lovely large bathroom...and like the previous poster had no issues with the 1/2 shower door. It was very hot in Paris when we were there but the ceiling fan and floor fan in the room kept things comfortable. I wished there was a mini fridge in the room to store cold drinks but we managed without. We did not eat the breakfast as we usually just grabbed a bite while we were out ( for much less than 10 euros!) Front desk staff were very friendly and helpful. I would stay there again in a heartbeat! It was comfy, clean and close to everything. P.S. Eat at Le Pre Verre across the street but make a reservation...tres bon!

Reviews.Title: “Great Latin Quarter location-best bathroom ever in Paris”
Reviews.Author: DisneyParis
Reviews.Content: Dates of Stay 20 July-22 July 2008 (2 nights) Great little family-run, inexpensive, clean hotel on Rue Thenard, one block south of Blvd St Germain and one block north of Rue des Ecoles-about 3 blocks east of Blvd St Michel. Excellent location for exploring all of Paris and near many great, inexpensive (for Paris) restaurants. Cute spiral staircase or elevator fine for 2 people and luggage. People at front desk always friendly and helpful and willing to let me speak French. Free internet in phone booth in lobby was great but had to leave door open since it could get stuffy. I don't bring my laptop to Europe so no comments about WIFI, but it is available. Didn't eat breakfast-10 euros looked like a lot for what was offered. We probably would have eaten there, but we slept in late the first morning after arriving late and finishing dinner at La Harpe after midnight and we left for the airport the second morning where we had access to the Air France Salon which provided complimentary breakfast and cocktails/champagne. HCF is a definite 5 rating on Trip Advisor for Paris. Unless you're looking for the Georges V or similar or need to stay in a different part of Paris, look no further. I can't imagine anything better on the left bank. Room #42-2 very comfortable, twin beds, free safe, flat screen TV, multi-speed fan with 2 windows opening onto Rue Thenard-might be problem if very, very hot outside but would have to be over 30C/86F at night, I think. How often does that happen in Paris? Noise not an issue when we were there. Extra outlets, if needed, near bed and elsewhere. They have those nasty long, round pillows, but there are good, normal, fluffly ones in the closet-so no pillow issue. Bathroom-best one I've ever had in Paris (I've stayed in many hotels, mostly 2* and 3*) Tub with shower (yes it has a half glass door, but if properly closed by lining up with side of tub and not bumping into while showering, no splatter issue) As in all Paris bathtubs, the side is steeper than the tubs in the US so you have to lift your legs higher. I get tired of hearing people complain about the half glass door and higher side on the tub! Bidet (didn't use), toilet, and sink. Some toiletries provided. Clean towels and restocked toiletries the 2nd day as well-not sure about sheets since I usually just sleep under top cover or duvet. Extras: -we arrived late the first night (at 10 pm), but everything was ready and waiting for us even though the hotel was full (complet) I had emailed the hotel to expect us around 9 pm, but our flight from Vienna was an hour late.
