Bottom line, they were honest and professional and had saved a quiet room with 2 beds as I had requested. -received wake up call as requested on morning of checkout -younger guy at front desk called Restaurant Le Buffet, Rue des Trois Freres, in Montmartre for me the see if they were open on a Monday evening-they had been closed in the early afternoon when I walked by. Their hours are "at their discretion and convenience, they will be open" but food-except for the green pepper sauce-and service is great if you speak some French. To summarize, the next time I stay in that part of Paris, I will definitely stay there. The HCF was significantly better than the Minerve or the Familia where I have stayed previously. Those are about the same price and actually about 2 blocks further away from everything.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel - Central”
Reviews.Author: CanadianBoys
Reviews.Content: Hotel College de France was a better hotel than we expected for the rate we paid. We stayed 7 nights second week of July 08. The location is left bank - and for us that is not our usual stomping grounds (anymore) but we wanted to try the hotel given the "rave" reviews. Hotel College is within easy short walking distance to Notre Dame/St Chapelle, the Louvre and d'Orsay museums. So how good was it?? By Paris standards (based on pus 25 trips) not bad at all. It is 2* - but about the best 2* you may find in Paris. Our room was a twin,with balcony and chairs & tables. Beds were comfortable, pillows are the role type, but regular ones were in the closet so we used those. Bathroom adequate, 1/2 shower door ensuring water always got on the floor :). Clean towels everyday, sheets changed every other day. As other reviewers mentioned, no air conditioning, but ceiling fan adequate when you open the 2 sets of double doors to balcony. Toiletries were of a poor quality (when replenished) so we went out and bought (we travel light). The room was large enough for us with 4 small suitcases. Room safe worked, as did the free Wi-Fi (great to have) even up to our floor with 3 different network connections. Pictures on their website are accurate. The hotel is in a quiet location with the restaurant Le PrÃ© Verre across the street. We had a so so meal there one night (with reservations) but we were not impressed (despite a great bottle of wine). Le Petite Prince a block south was much more charming, with superior food and service and is a better value. Last but not least, the hotel is surrounded by multiple locations (8 or 9) of camping/outdoor adventure stores. The store is housed in many locations in the immediate blocks surrounding the hotel everything from clothing, camping, clothes, ski gear, travel gadgets (electrical converters and plugs), luggage, packs, a map and travel book store - Engish as well (best anywhere). Enough to keep a man busy for an entire day :).

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Gem!”
Reviews.Author: ellenkf
Reviews.Content: My daughter and I spent 3 days at this wonderful hotel. I booked here because of the reviews I had read and was not disappointed. The staff is lovely and very helpful with recommendations and directions. The hotel is small and charming. The rooms have plenty of room and the bathrooms are immaculate. The tubs have 1/2 shower doors but we managed not to flood the floors too terribly. There is no air conditioning, but the ceiling fan and floor fan plus having the windows open were more than enough for us. This is a fabulous find for those on a budget. The location can not be beat.

Reviews.Title: “Loved Hotel du College de France”
Reviews.Author: AussieTripper100
Reviews.Content: I stayed at Hotel du College de France in early June 2008 and absolutely loved it. It was first trip to Paris and what a great introduction. All of the hotel's front desk staff were very helpful and very friendly, they made me feel very welcome. I liked the location a lot and its easy access to the Metro was great. The rooms are well priced and very clean with all of the amenities you need. I'm used to staying in 4 and 5 star Australian hotels and had adjusted my expectations about what European hotels would be like. I thought the hotel was charming, good price for breakfast and the free internet access (in the indoor phone booth) was a real bonus since internet access costs can really add up. The restaurant recommendations were great as well, the hotel is a few minutes walking distance to many good restaurants.

Reviews.Title: “What a great deal! Want to go back! Charming!”
Reviews.Author: 917p3
Reviews.Content: Hotel College de France shocked us. What a great little hotel! The location is perfectâ€¦ quiet but close to everything in the Latin Quarter. There is a wine bar across the street and it is near the college district. It is a solid 10-15 minute walk from the metro with luggage. The hotel staff is very kind. Our room was clean and the safe worked. There is no air conditioning, but the ceiling fan was adequate and the huge windows open easily. One of the best partsâ€¦ free, fast wifi internet access. Hotel College is within easy short walking distance from the Pantheon and Notre Dame/St Chapelle. We also walked to the Louvre and Orsay museums. There are seemingly endless restaurants in the immediate vicinity. We spent more money for a lesser hotel elsewhere in Paris and were upset that we did not just remain at Hotel du College de France.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for us!”
Reviews.Author: ssweeney7
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel with a friend of mine for three nights. It was absolutely perfect for us! We were looking for something low cost that was in a great location. We shared the one bed, which wasn't very comfortable, and the view from our room was of a cement wall... but really how much time do you plan to spend in the room anyway?!?! Oh and the hair dryer was not good at all.. bring your own!! If you don't have your own converter they will provide you with one at the front desk. Also, there is a computer for your use in the lobby. The staff is nice and helpful, and they speak English very well. There are some nice inexpensive places to eat right around the hotel, but I can't remember the names of any of the places we went. You can walk anywhere from the hotel. The first day we walked to Notre Dame, then back to the hotel to catch up on zzzz's! It is definitely worth the extra money to go to the top to see the gargoyles and the view of the city. The second day we walked to the Louvre, down Champs Elysees to the Arc de Triomphe, all the way to the Catacombs (very long walk), and then back to the Eiffel Tower! We are both young and very active, so it worked for us. The metro station is right by the hotel so on the third day we went to Montmarte. Besides getting to and from the airport, it was the only time we used public transportation!! We walked to the Sacre Coeur and Moulin Rouge and hit up some of the boutiques. When we got back to the hotel we walked over to le Bon Marche department store and grocery store. The grocery store is a great place to get some souveniers... they have herbs for only a couple of dollars that make a nice gift since the packaging is in French! A litle more romantic!! We live in NYC so we are used to walking a lot, but this was a great itinerary and I recommend it to anyone in Paris for a short trip!

Reviews.Title: “awesome stay”
Reviews.Author: verbet
Reviews.Content: we spent 6 great nights at this hotel a small hotel but the rooms were of an adequate size room to move , a desk & 2 windows over looking the street This hotel is in the St Germain area & is within walking distance to all the sights or the metro is close by anyway .Breakfast at 10 euro,was adequate for a days walking coffee was good.There are plenty of restraunts in the St Germain area the one across from the hotel (forgot name) is worth a visit as is The Little Prince nearby great french food.This is a great hotel highly recommended

Reviews.Title: “Very pleased! Highly recommend”
Reviews.Author: Carly_Dawn
Reviews.Content: I booked the superior double room with balcony (room 62) for 5 nights. For the price and fact that it's a 2 star, i admit that i was nervous about arriving and what i was going to find. A 2 min walk from Maubert station, we were pleased to have found it so quickly from Gare du Nord. The outside is tidy and Parisian style. The decor of the reception is a bit odd but we had a very warm welcome and we were allowed to check in 2 hours early without a problem. We were very pleased with our room - i knew that we were going to have the largest, but it was bigger than i thought. The bathroom was also a good size for a French hotel, and the balcony was so nice! They provide a little table and 2 chairs to sit outside, you overlook the Hotel College de France in front of you, which is a lovely building, to your left is a little church and to your right - the eiffel tower! The bed was a double, no smaller or larger. It was comfortable. And the cleaner made our room spotless everyday. Regarding noise - we only heard our neighbours briefly once or twice - our room only had people on one side so that prob helps! The staff are so friendly, helpful and speak perfect English. The location is perfect - metro 2 mins walk away, Notre Dame and the Seine is about 10 minutes. We walked from Arc de Triomphe to our hotel in an hour. The food and cafe's around the area are fantastic - can't beat breakfast at Rue Mouffetard market. I would highly recommend staying here!

Reviews.Title: “A very nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: g_maenchen
Reviews.Content: We recently spent a week in paris and were very pleased by the Hotel du College de France. The location was dandy, the hotel exquisitely clean and neat, the staff friendly and helpful and even the breakfast was quite superior. An excellent value for the money. We would definitely stay there agan.

Reviews.Title: “Cheap yet decent”
Reviews.Author: whiteshadow
Reviews.Content: This two star is good value in Paris Latin Quarter area just a block off Blvd. Saint Germain near Rue St. Jacques. We stayed in the cheapest double room at 99 euros per night. It was clean with sufficient lighting for reading and had a lcd tv with about 15 stations. Two metro stations about 6-8 minutes walk away. Breakfast at 10 euros per person is ok but the cheese is in small packages and the fruit salad was filled with green apple slices. No forks provided so one has to use the same spoon to mix coffee, eat yogurt and try to get the ham slice without falling on the table. Only six or seven small tables in breakfast area and if filled you will be told to wait which could take some time before a table opens. This place is inexpensive but is not a dump. Stay here and save money for a nice dinner every day. Front desk people are friendly and seemed ready to accomodate.

Reviews.Title: “Pleased in every way!”
Reviews.Author: G57
Reviews.Content: I can only say good things about this hotel. Given that this is a two star hotel, the location, reception, cleanliness and comfort were faultless. It was extremely easy to find and superbly located. We went everywhere on foot reaching many of the sights in minutes.We were delighted with the reception from M. Santa Ana, were fortunate to have an upgrade to a room with a balcony and this proved a real asset. Furthermore, on the last day, the hotel allowed us to leave our luggage in storage until our flight. As hotels in Europe do not tend to provide coffee making facilities it is an idea to bring a travel kettle if at all possible. We will certainly return and thought twice about writing this due to the fear that the positive publicity might mean that we might not be able to obtain a room in the future but this hotel deserves more positive reviews enabling it to be higher on the list. Well done .......et Ã  bientÃ´t!!

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel Awesome location”
Reviews.Author: signinsareapain
Reviews.Content: We liked this property. On a scale of 1- 5 (5 being the best) Location: 5+++ Cleanness: 4+ Room size: 2.5 Barely fit the 2 of us, our 2 med. size suitcases and 2 backpacks Room view: 3 (We had an interior rooms w/ a view of 'nothing' - which was better than a trash dumpsters) Bed comfort: 4 I am 6" and it was a hint too short. We used the extra pillows in closet Bathroom size: 4 Not large but I have stayed in places in Europe where it was much smaller. Has a med. strength blow dry. Only electrical outlet, in the bathroom, is for razors. There is an outlet and mirror in the room by the 'desk' area. Staff knowledge: 3 Staff Friendliness: 4+ Use of a computer w/ free internet (in the lobby.) Directions on hotels website were perfect. Cafes and shops nearby for a quick meal or snacks for the room. No issues w/ noise level Helpful hints: - We went to the 11 p.m. show at the Moulion Rouge on Sun and ended up having to take taxi back to the hotel because the subways were closed. (It was only 10 Euro w/ tip.) - Suggest either taking a tour (for express admission) or getting to Versailles super early. We arrived 15 mins. before they opened and aprox. 300 people were in line ahead of us. Additionally - If you are traveling there on your own - buy a Versailles pass. We got ours at the St. Michaels metro station. It includes a 4 zone metro pass (valid all day), entrance to all areas at Versailles plus an audio guide. Note - expect long lines for the toilettes and make sure you get your ticket signed at each 'point'. A couple went to the bathroom and didn't get their tickets singed before entering that area so they were not allowed back in. - Suggest going to the Eiffel tower in the evening. The line was not as long as first thing in the morning. - LOpen Tour bus stops service on the orange and blue routes at 7pm. The green route continues until 8 p.m. - Museums are free the first Sunday of the month. - Beer and cocktails can be expensive so look for bars w/ happy hour - they usually offer beverages at 25 - 50 % off.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyable stay”
Reviews.Author: l'afrique
Reviews.Content: We both enjoyed our stay at the Hotel College du france. Room 62 was a decent size and clean and comfortable. We paid E120 a night. The cleaning staff and waitress in the dining room were friendly and efficient and breakfast was good value. It was useful to have a computer with 24hr internet connection in the lobby. The location of the hotel was very central and in a 5 day period we managed to walk to most sights. We only used 12 metro tickets between the two of us. Apart from an error in our bill where we were not credited for our deposit and had to produce evidence that we had paid it in mid 2007 and a feeling that the front desk could have been less tardy when we had a problem with our room safe, we were pleased with the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant stay at the Hotel du College de France!!!”
Reviews.Author: happycamper078
Reviews.Content: Spent three nights in the Hotel du Colege de France and absolutely loved it. Super location staying in the beautiful Latin Quarter, really close to the Metro and very reasonably priced by Paris standards. Don't get me wrong not the most chic hotel in Paris but the staff are great, the hotel is clean and the location brilliant. What more could you want??

Reviews.Title: “Helpful and Overall nice hotel.”
Reviews.Author: ktscott01
Reviews.Content: Overall we were happy with the hotel. Location is very good and so was the price for Paris. We showed up very early and they were happy to hold our luggage until our room was ready. It was a bit strange but they told us it would be ready in 1 hour. When we returned about 6 hours later they said it still wasn't ready but they put us in room 63 right away. Checkin No problems here. They just moved us to room 63 to get us in. Very friendly and helpful. We paid 99 euros a night Friday-Tuesday. Room We were in room 63 on the top floor. They had a lift to the 5th fool then you had to walk 1 flight of stairs. No problem at all. It was a nice size with a small TV and a desk. The room also had a safe which is great when traveling with your passports. Bed Bed was ok. I can't say I ever woke up with a stiff back so it served it purpose for 4 nights. Bathroom Equipped and stocked daily. They did have soap and shampoo to use. Shower/Tub This was a mess. They had a small tub with a handheld shower head. The tub was too short to put your legs out straight. The holder for the shower head was only at waist level when standing, no higher. Needless to say the bathroom would be covered in water when you were done, whether you sat or stood. There was one morning where the hot water took a little while but after it came it didn't run out. TV They had a small TV in the room. We got 3 English news channels. BBC, CNN and SkyNews. Breakfast We skipped it because it was 10 euros and it didn't really look worth it at all. Checkout No problems here either. We checked right out and were on our way. We were billed the correct amount when we got home. Internet Computer They had a computer setup to check email which was very helpful. Area around the hotel There are a lot of choices of places to eat within a few blocks, mostly sandwich or crepe shops. A lot of tourist places so fixed price menus and higher prices. The RER and subway are also pretty close, there are three locations to choose from. If you had to walk to the Louvre its really not that far, maybe 30 minutes or so. 10 minutes to Notre Dame. Overall I would stay where again and also tell friends. The front desk was helpful when we had questions and he just laughed when we tried to speak French. HCF was a great starting point to explore all of Paris.

Reviews.Title: “great location and great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: CheekyAngel
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 4 nights in March. Was easy to book direct via the net, quick response received. Good: - great location and great value for money. - Plenty of good restaurants around - you MUST eat at the restaurant across the road from the hotel "Le Pre Verre", fantastic food! - Room size was OK for a twin. Was clean with a decent bathroom. - Metro was within a 5 minute walk. Bad: Bit noisy - can hear your "neighbours" breakfast - give it a miss, lots of places to get something to eat. Would think about staying here again.

Reviews.Title: “Super value”
Reviews.Author: Alistair_Lodge
Reviews.Content: Great value for money. Superb location in the Latin quarter and very close to RER B St Michael station. Decent breakfast to set you up for the day. Helpful at the desk - I can't believe the array of languages these guys can speak. Yes, certain things in the hotel are small, but not enough to put anyone off.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding Manager and Staff”
Reviews.Author: Memphis_Tourist
Reviews.Content: It seems superfluous to add yet another good review, but ... here goes. The Hotel du College de France was in an excellent location five minutes from the St. Michel metro stop, which made getting there from CDG easy, and a brief walk from the Ile-de-la-Cite! The room was small but clean and everything in it was new. Above all, the staff was cheerful, helpful and spoke excellent English. When the lights in our room went out --- in the middle of the night, at the beginning of Easter weekend! --- the manager --- Mark --- came from home and fixed them! I found this hotel on www.TripAdvisor.com and I'm glad I did.

Reviews.Title: “Ten out of ten!”
Reviews.Author: HeatherandLaura
Reviews.Content: My daughter and I stayed in the College de France for 4 nights from 26 Feb 2008. I chose it because of the favourable TripAdvisor reviews and it was exceptionally good in every way, and fantastic value at 99 euros a night. We had a standard twin room which was bigger than I had expected but they do vary. It was really well appointed, nicely decorated, well maintained and absolutely spotless. The chambermaids were very well trained and efficient though we never saw them! The beds were superbly comfortable, with good linen. A previous reviewer has complained of the bed size, which is a mystery - they are standard singles, and anyway my online booking confirmation actually gave their size. The online booking was very efficient. I asked for a large room high up in the building and that is what we got. The 5th floor is the more expensive superior rooms: we were on the 4th. Some reviewers have grumbled about the lift, which was indeed small but it took the two of us and our luggage easily - and it was bright, fresh and pleasant to use which is not always the case. The location of the hotel is perfect. It's in a quiet side street - probably as quiet as it gets in Paris. Plenty of restaurants close by, including the best one right across the street. Five minutes walk to the metro and buses - and the Seine - and less than 10 from Notre Dame. Again, a previous review was misleading as it said 15 minutes to the metro which it certainly wasn't, unless you are on a zimmer frame. We didn't have the breakfast so I can't comment, and neither did we have any contact with staff except for the two very pleasant managers, as everything we needed was provided and we didn't have to ask for anything. I would recommend the College de France to anybody, and would gladly stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Really nice place”
Reviews.Author: Boanyoo
Reviews.Content: This place was great to us. When I booked, you could only book via thier website & there were no last minute deals which to me says they know they have a quality product. If you understand yo are staying in a two star hotel, then all will be fine. The rooms are small but clean. The staff are exceptionally helpful and the location is very easy to get around from. Keep in mind the place is old, so the walls are thin. I'd recomend a room not close to the elevator.

Reviews.Title: “Great location , OK service”
Reviews.Author: picolina
Reviews.Content: I love the location (Paris 5, near Notre Dame, ile Saint Louis, Saint Germain des Pres...), the hotel itself lacks the charm that would make it unforgettable. I was given a room facing the courtyard, so there was no light. The room itself was a bit dissapointing, it looks so much like an old room in the attic at your grandma's place, instead of a room designed to please. I did not need help from the staff and had little interaction with them. It has free wifi so it was convenient to access the internet in your own room. Having said all this, the price is not bad for the location. Since I just need a place to sleep in a nice location, I would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Average Stay”
Reviews.Author: poseidon_paterson
Reviews.Content: The best thing about HCF is the location. It's around 100m from the Rue St.Jacques entrance of Cluny la Sorbonne Metro Entrance. Getting here was very easy. From Charles de Gaulle, we bought a Carte Orange (it was 8Euro for a week travel on all public transport in Zones 1-5 [includes Disneyland], but we bought it on Wednesday morning, so it was cheaper than if it was bought on Monday or Tuesday [weekly Carte Orange expire on Sundays]. From RER Line B, it was a 30min ride to St. Michel station (connected underground to Cluny- La Sorbonne. From there, it's around a 10min walk to the hotel, so long as you take the Rue St. Jacques exit. The hotel is surrounded by plenty of little cafes and restaurants, but a recommended is Le Coup Chou restaurant, about 5 mins from the hotel. It's a quiet part of town. Now, about the hotel itself. Firstly, it's very cramped. The lobby is very small, and the lift can only fit 1 person with a suitcase. Most of the time we used the staircase with its nuisance automatic lighting system that turned on too late. The lock/key system is difficult to use the first few times (the cleaning lady had to show us) and since the room electricity is controlled by the key, that was a further annoyance. The standard rooms are rather small (rooms on 6th floor are considerably larger), but functional. The beds are firm. The staff are cheery and Mr Marc is a wealth of knowledge. Another positive comment is that there is free internet usage in the lobby, and there is hardly ever a wait for it. Overall, HCF was a pleasant experience, but for the price we paid (over 700Euros for 2 rooms for 3 nights), we feel that we could have done better for Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel for a reasonable price”
Reviews.Author: Patty1234
Reviews.Content: We stayed one night at this hotel in Nov 2007 and we paid 97 Euro for the stay. The price is okay but not the best. It is conveniently located and is about a 15 min walk from the closest metro station. The room was small but that was expected for a Parisian hotel. The entire building was a bit dated and the amenities were rather old. The bathroom was small. I am not obese in anyway. Even for a 130 lb person like me, I have problem getting in and out of the shower. It is how small the bathroom was. For one night, I did not care that much. However, I have to recommend a restaurant that locates just opposite the hotel, Le Pre Verre, 8, Rue Thenard, 75005, Paris (Tel 01 43 54 59 47). The fix prix lunch there was sensationally good. The price was excellent as well. My wife and I went there twice and we were extremely impressed.

Reviews.Title: “College de France--just right for us”
Reviews.Author: Capitol Hill
Reviews.Content: Guided by Tripadvisor reviews, we stayed at the College de France for three nights 18-20 Jan. We love the 5th and have been searching for a well-priced, comfortable property for some time since several of our old favorites in the neighborhood have jacked up their prices a lot. Boy, did we make a good decision. We stayed in a standard twin which was small but...somehow also charming and cozy, in a good way. The bathroom was new with a tub/shower combo with great water pressure. A stay during the summer might be a problem because there is no AC and there is some street noise when the windows are open, but that would lead to a request for a room on the back of the hotel or side street, as opposed to Rue Thenard. There are ceiling fans. Would recommend this friendly, well cared-for property to anyone looking for unpretentious, comfortable accommodations in the 5th.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay at the HCF!”
Reviews.Author: TravelingMx
Reviews.Content: This hotel is really amazing! The service is great, mi room (52) was quite big by Paris standards... with 2 single beds together (acting as a double), a desk and a huge marble bathroom and a terrace!... the location is amazing and the area is lovely! though the hotel is not noisy at all! the personnel at the front desk were very warm, polite and accomodating at all times! If in Paris again I would definitely stay here... attached some pictures of my room... Regards, Luis

Reviews.Title: “Fantistic Hotel - Friendly Staff”
Reviews.Author: 3dogsmom
Reviews.Content: This hotel was fantistic. I had the opportunity to come to France with three of my sisters and my mother this last November. My mom has some mobility problems and the hotel was great about assistance. The staff was very knowageable and friendly. They gave directions in an easy to understand manner and were so helpful with every detail. This was my second trip to Paris and if there is a third, I will definately stay here again! The rooms were great in size and cleanlieness especially for Europe. The location could not have been better! Overall, this hotel and its staff helped to make this a trip of a lifetime! Thanks!!

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyable Stay”
Reviews.Author: Aussietravellers16
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed 3 nights in this small boutique hotel. Location is great, right in the heart of the Latin Quarter with 2 metro lines only minutes walk away - also lots of places to eat within walking distance. Staff were helpful and there was free wifi internet access (one of the few places in France/Germany we stayed that it was free so that was appreciated). Room was spotless and best of all we had 2 small balconies with a little table and 2 chairs (not that we used them, being winter!) but it was nice all the same. Notre Dame only 5 minutes walk away; we walked to the Rue Mouffetard markets also but that took about 20 minutes and being winter I don't think they were in full swing as they are usually (we were a bit disappointed to be honest). There is also some room service (huge hot chocolates, and very yummy). Be warned, the lift is tiny but it was fun trying to cram the 2 of us and our 2 suitcases in (these had to be stacked on top of eachother). Only downside: our room was small compared to others in Europe but we did expect small rooms everywhere. However the bed was tiny. We were sent dimension details when we booked but we didn't realise just how small till we arrived (my husband is not even 6 foot and his feet were hanging over the end of the bed). A bit uncomfortable but so were most of the beds and pillows in Europe.

Reviews.Title: “Will definitely stay here again!”
Reviews.Author: Debbie_F
Reviews.Content: This is a great budget hotel (and with the dollar/euro exchange rate - who isn't looking for a good budget hotel!). Clean, friendly, has a small lift, hair dryer, free internet, bedside lamps for reading, closet, tv. Small rooms, but functional. We stayed in room 45. Great location - near restaurants, metro (more useful when workers aren't striking), and within easy walking distance of the Louvre (20 min), notre dame (10 min), atms. A really great place to stay. I do have one comment - we could sometimes hear the flushing of the toilet in a neighboring room. This was not a problem for us, but could be seen as a negative by some.

Reviews.Title: “Second stay -- great hotel, great location”
Reviews.Author: mediachick
Reviews.Content: This was my second time staying here, and I loved it. The staff is really friendly, you get to know them by the time you leave. My room was a fairly decent size -- not as big as American hotel rooms -- but no one spends time in their hotel room in Paris. The room had two huge windows, which made it bright and cheery. And the free Internet access in the lobby is really nice. The location is perfect, just steps from Blvd St. Germain and a few blocks from Place St. Michel. There are 3 metro stops nearby: Cluny, Maubert Mutualite, or walk a little further to St. Michel, where the RER stops. There is a great street market around the corner at Maubert Mutualite, as well as several shops there that sell cheese, meat, wine, etc. For those like me who like coffee in a paper cup (emporter) when you're running late in the morning, there is a to-go coffee shop across the street on Blvd St-Germain. There is also a Franprix grocery store around the corner. The only drawback is that the walls are thin, and I could sometimes hear people's voices. And you get the street noise of garbage trucks, etc. But you have to expect that in a large city. I'm pretty sensitive to noise, and none of it bothered me enough that I would change locations. I would stay here again, and would highly recommend this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Superb Hotel!!”
Reviews.Author: rosstheboss
Reviews.Content: Funnily enough i booked this gem of a hotel based on the previous reviews and yes its good, its very good in fact. Its location is its selling point, then the breakfast which is eat as much as you want (and we did!!) and then the cleanliness of the rooms. I stayed in room 44 which was functional and spotlessly clean. The staff are pleasant and speak good english. Also there's a cracking irish bar in the side street to the right of the fountain (by st michel metro) and when your hungry a relatively cheap and atmospheric restaurant next to it... Merci beaucoup!!

Reviews.Title: “Great little hotel”
Reviews.Author: Glenn22
Reviews.Content: We chose this hotel for a one week stay based on Trip Advisor ratings - and agree with the high rating of this hotel. Fantastic location close to metro and RER direct from the airport. Small, simple rooms, but very clean and everything you need for a vacation hotel. A great budget hotel choice!!

Reviews.Title: “An absolute gem”
Reviews.Author: FrequentTravellers
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel on the basis of Tripadvisor reviews and its Tripadvisor ranking, for a three-day stopover on the way home from a tour of Tunisia. Believe the ranking - this hotel is a gem. It is not for those who want all kinds of room to spread out - everything is very compact. However, everything is there, including hair dryers and free internet access. The hotel is immaculately clean everywhere, the petit dÃ©jeuner is excellent - croissants, baguettes, cheeses, marmalades, ham, superb coffee - and the staff could not be friendlier or more helpful. We were faced with getting to the airport on the day of a comprehensive public transit strike; no buses, metro, or trains and a consequent dearth of taxis. The hotel offered to extend our stay if we could change our flight (we couldn't) or release us from our last night's obligation if we wanted to relocate to somewhere near the airport. They eventually arranged a limousine (expensive, but worth it). The location is excellent - close to the metro and the RER to/from the airport (if it is running). A word of caution - you cannot get on or off the RER at either end without climbing up and/or down stairs, so guide yourself accordingly based on the number and weight of suitcases. You are 3 minutes' walk from Notre Dame, the PanthÃ©on, the Sorbonne, the MusÃ©e de Cluny and literally dozens of restaurants. St-Germain-des-Pres is a 15-minute walk, as is the MusÃ©e d'Orsay. We walked to the Galeries Lafayette, which is a bit of a hike, but all manageable. Next trip to Paris, we know where we will be staying. If we need to schedule around the availability of the HCF, so be it.

Reviews.Title: “Highly recommend the Hotel du College de France”
Reviews.Author: LolaHonolulu
Reviews.Content: I just returned from staying at the Hotel du College de France for three nights. I loved this place because it is in a perfect location - on the left Bank in the Latin Quarter, and only about a block from the closest metro stop. My hotel room was small but very adequate and the bathroom was clean and functional. The owners are very easy to work with - just let them know your prefernce re: room (e.g. on a lower floor or whatever) and they will go out of their way to accommodate you. Also, they are extremely helpful regarding providing guests with directions to tourist sites, with maps and written instructions, etc. I went out to Versailles one day, and they gave me the most complete and accurate directions. One of the highlights of this hotel is the breakfast. At 8 euro, it is a great, all-you-can-eat bargain. Overall, I thought this hotel was a real "find", and would recommend it to anyone looking for the combination of a bargain hotel and a very pleasant stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay -- very highly recommend this gem”
Reviews.Author: nnsanci
Reviews.Content: The staff is very friendly, and didn't mind waking up to let us in at 3 a.m. The hotel is conveniently located, quiet, and clean. I would very highly recommend this hotel. It is nothing fancy, but a real bargain and I will certainly stay there again!!!

Reviews.Title: “Hotel College de France, 5th arrondissement”
Reviews.Author: crazylab
Reviews.Content: Hotel Du College de France, 7 rue Thenard, 75005 Paris. What a discovery for us. Location, location, location ! Small hotel with 6 floors and a tiny elevator located between le quartier latin et St-Germain. Rooms are small, nice, clean, comfy and quiet. We had room 52 with a tiny balcony. We loved it. Staff is nice and effective, good english. You can walk (or take bus,subway,train )everywhere from the hotel. Close to shopping, all the main attractions of Paris plus dozens of restaurants. Sept. 0,7 it cost 99 euros/night/2 pers. We parked our car at a nearby (10 min.walk) underground parking lot rue LaGrange 24 euros/24 hrs. We enjoyed it very much.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Place”
Reviews.Author: monalua
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hotel du College last week for 4 nights and would highly recommend it. It was our first trip to Europe, and we were quite nervous - but the Hotel du College made us feel right at home. Front desk staff were among the friendliest and most genuine we've encountered at any hotel. They also spoke perfect English, while welcoming our attempts at French. Hotel is in a great location in the Latin Quarter, 10-minute walk to Notre Dame, 5-minute walk to two Metro stations and an RER station (St. Michel/Notre Dame, which could get us anywhere). Felt like a very safe neighborhood, lots of shops and restaurants around. There was a Franprix (grocery store) about 2 blocks away. We also found a handy McDonald's about 3 blocks away, as well as a pharmacy. Our room was immaculately clean. It was smallish, but larger than what I was expecting for a hotel in Paris, and very quaint and cozy. Had a nice flat-panel TV. Bathroom had a tub with one of those removable nozzle-type shower heads placed very low, which was a pain for my 6'3" husband, but he managed. Hotel did not supply washcloths (seems most of Europe is this way), so bring your own (we did). Hotel also did not have an alarm clock (neither did our hotel in London), but the front desk had reliable wake-up calls every morning. We could see the tip top of the Eiffel Tower from our window in our 6th floor room! Hotel has breakfast for an additional 8 Euros a day, which we did a couple of times. It's all-you-can-eat/drink, so I thought it was a decent value. Coffee, OJ, yummy croissaints and bread, ham, yogurt, and somes cheeses. Check-in took less than 2 minutes, and check-out was a breeze. I wouldn't hesitate to recommend this hotel. It's not luxurious, but for the price, it has a great location, friendly staff, it's VERY CLEAN, and safe. We really enjoyed staying here.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, great price”
Reviews.Author: NalaMelbourne
Reviews.Content: My husband and l stayed at this hotel for 4 nights in July. We thought it was a great hotel. We booked our stay via the hotel website and everything worked out fine when we arrived. The staff were lovely, very helpful and kind, not rude or arrogant. The room seemed to have been renovated recently and was very pleasant. The bathroom was a good size also. The hotel has free internet on one laptop, but you have to get in quick, ahead of all the teenagers, we used it one morning at 1am! The location of the hotel we thought was perfect, 2 minutes walk to two different metro stations (take your pick) and 5 minutes walk to the Notre Dame or the Pantheon. Its in the Latin Quarter and very close to all the restaurants, lane ways and shops - which was great, maybe a 5 minute walk to this area. We also walked to the Louvre one day too, it was a good walk, but still you could do it if you wanted the exercise. The only downfall would perhaps be that we could hear people coming and going on our floor and we had some loud people! We tried to sleep in on our last day and it wasn't a very deep sleep from the early morning onwards. I guess that could change depending on who is staying in the hotel. This hotel l would definitely recommend, it was clean, good sized rooms and excellent value for money considering you're in Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Two Star Gem.”
Reviews.Author: fmack
Reviews.Content: For a comfortable, friendly, convenient, Left Bank hotel - this hotel is highly recommended. It's not for those seeking 5* luxury or hot and cold running waiters, but for the visitors who wish an unpretentious but authentic and very well managed local hotel - look no further. Rooms/ bathrooms are small (by U. S. standards) but very well maintained and scrupulously clean. Flat screen TV, individual secure storage and broadband access are included in the very reasonable room rates. Breakfast, (8 Euros) where you will be served (though that's not the right word) by one of two very pleasant, local ladies - is excellent value. My only concern in writing this review is that, too many people will realise that this is probably the best two star hotel in Paris and there will be no room for us the next time we go back .

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel marred by clerical error”
Reviews.Author: akhughes
Reviews.Content: We arrived at the Hotel just after lunchtime on a friday, after having an early 4am start from Belfast. Got the RER B from CDG and it was a short walk to the Hotel. Couldn't be better. However when we arrived, it turned out there was no record of our booking.... :(. Gutted. I had booked the Hotel directly via email, but it appeared that this hadn't been 'put into the system'. Luckily for me, i had a complete print out of the entire email transcript, so it was immediately obvious that they had made the mistake. If i hadn't have had this.... I think we may have been left to our own devices! However we recieved an apology, free breakfasts for the rest of our stay, and accomodation in the neighboring Hotel Latin for the first night of our stay until a room would become available. The Hotel Latin was 'fair' enough. No major issues with it. clean, comfortable, but nothing spectacular. However the remaining two nights in the College Du France where excellant. A much nicer finish to the rooms, quiet, clean... and actually larger rooms than i expected! Very happy with the Hotel. Also in an excellant location. Very handy for the CDG and Orly trains, Very handy for the Metro and an bewildering aray of Restaurants, Brasseries and Cafes near by. I'd certianly go back, and recommend the Hotel, just make sure you bring a record of your booking!!

Reviews.Title: “Nice Clean room, great price and location”
Reviews.Author: kimncris
Reviews.Content: We found this hotel through tripadvisor and once again you failed to dissapoint! We were able to reserve easily through a couple of simple emails (they have a website www hotel-collegedefrance com) and the rates for central Paris were VERY reasonable! We have paid less, but not within blocks of the ile de la cite. It was also right next to the Cluny museum which was something we wanted to visit this time, and within an easy walk of the Jardin de Lumembourg. The rooms were tiny of course, but clean, the bathroom had a hair dryer and finally on our trip there was a safe for storing documents/valuables etc. Ours was on the 5th floor (54 I think). There's an elevator if you want it, but it was small, so we usually took the pretty stairs. We did not have the breakfast. The front desk service was a little chilly at first, but then the next couple of days it was fine and they even gave us a free map which has never happened to us in Paris. Anyway- I took some pictures so you can see for yourself. We'll definitely stay again if we make it back to Paris. -cris

Reviews.Title: “Pleasantly Surprised”
Reviews.Author: Getgerald
Reviews.Content: First of all, you get good value for the price. The hotel is in a quiet side street of the Boulevard St. Germain. If you arrive at Charles de Gaulle Airport, it is very convenient to take the RER (if it runs) to St. Michel station. From there, it is a 5 minute walk to the hotel. The hotel itsself is centrally located in St. Germain. To give you an idea, it takes max 10 minutes to walk to Notre Dame. Good cafes and restaurants are in close proximity. The rooms are small and very clean, but it is an excellent value for the price you pay (90 Euro/night). The staff is very friendly and patient, helps to get you directions, a cork-screw if you need it etc. Therefore I can only highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Personal touch”
Reviews.Author: suntravelor
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed 4 nights in mid May and loved our visit. We arrived by car, double parked out front of the hotel (garage parking is nearby) and were warmly greeted by the young owner, Jean Marc. He immediately set our minds at ease, carried our bags into the hotel, watched the car for us as we got settled in our rooms and got us oriented with the local area. The Latin Quarter is a great base for touring Paris. I say this, because yes, the hotel is modest but very nice, the location is superb, the breakfast was fine etc..., but Mr. Marc and the other staff (all speak English) consistently went out of their way to enhance our stay. One night we returned with a bottle of champagne (we stayed in room 62, top floor, which has a balcony and distant view of the Eiffel Tower-quite a nice place to enjoy a glass of wine!). Mr. Marc took our champagne as we entered the hotel and said to give him a moment and he would be up to the room with it. In 5 minutes he arrived at our door with the bottle on ice and two nice glasses. I considered this amazing service and made our little event so much better. There were several other anecdotes demonstrating the personal touch, suffice it to say, we were very happy with our stay. Again, the location is wonderful and for the money it is a wonderful little hotel that is clean and comfortable. If any flaw exists (and we found this typical of European hotels), the beds are rather small though not uncomfortable. Hotel du College de France is well worth considering for a stay in Paris, and I strongly believe the personal touch adds great value to your stay. George and Hannah

Reviews.Title: “Great Parisian Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Jasperdo
Reviews.Content: The Hotel du College de France lives up to all the good reviews it receives. My wife and I stayed there for 5 nights last month, and were completely satisfied. It is a charming, small, family run hotel. The owner, Mr. Marc was at the front desk nearly every day. So was Mr. Sadr, who has worked at the hotel for many tears. It was nice to see the people from their website actually working there. We stayed in Room 25, which is a basic room with one double bed. The furnishings aren't antique, but they were functional. The bathroom was good sized by European standards, modern and very clean, we had a bath/shower combo, which had excellent water pressure and temperature. The window in the bath had transparent contact paper that looked like a Stained Glass window. The room also had a flat screen TV and a 5 speed fan. The fan is operated by a white box alongside the bed. It came in handy on a couple of warm nights. We had a nice view down Rue de Latran from our room. Free Wi-Fi Internet is available in every room as well. We brought our PDA and it worked just fine to check our e-mail. One odd feature about the rooms at the Hotel du College de France is that your room key is also used to turn the lights on in your room. There is a credit card type thing attached to the key, and you insert it into the slot on the wall to power up your room. I guess this saves electricity since you can't leave the lights on when you leave the room. The Hotel also follows the standard European practice of leaving the room key at the front desk when you go out for the day. There is a nice little sitting area just off the front desk area. It is stocked with numreous travel books about Paris and France. There is also a laptop computer in the old phone booth that can be used to check your e-mail as well. There is a spiral staircase that is decorated in the Half Timber style. You can also take a tiny, tiny elevator. Two people can barely fit in the lift. When we checked in, there wasn't room for both of us and our luggage. My wife went up with the suitcases. I walked up the spiral staircase. The breakfast room is small, but adaquate for the number of guests at the hotel. It has the typical French hotel items: croissants, bagette bread, sliced ham, assorted cheeses, yogurt and 2 types of cereal. There is also orange juice and cold milk on the buffet. When you first sit down, the server will ask if you want coffee or tea. They will also ask for your room number, so you can be charged the 8 Euro per person fee for the breakfast. This is a normal practice in France. We had breakfast at the Hotel every morning. It was a good, all you can eat spread. We didn't have to hunt for breakfast somewhere else. The location of the Hotel is excellent as well. It is well situated in the Left Bank, in the Latin Quarter. Blvd. Saint Germain is a short block away. It has numerous cafes and restaurants. Most of them are to the left when you get to the Boulevard. However, if you go to the right, it is a very short walk to Place Maubert, which is a charming Parisian Square with a nice selection of cafes. Also at Place Maubert in one of the 2 nearby Metro stations. The other is to the left on St. Germain at Cluny. There is also excellent bus service. Eastbound busses travel on Blvd. St. Germain...westbound busses (towards the Eiffel Tower) travel down Rue des Ecoles, one block south. It is also very easy to get to the Hotel from CDG Airport. We took an express train, RER B, directly from Terminal 2 to St. Michel station. It was a short walk to the hotel from there. Speaking of walking, there are many sites within walking distance from the Hotel. Ile de la Cite and Notre Dame are about 5 minutes away. The Cluny Museum is even closer. The restaurants on Rue de la Harpe are also very close. The Pantheon and the Louvre are walkable too, but a bit further...about 15 minutes. Plus, the hotel is located in a very nice part of the Left Bank, so just going out and wandering the nearby streets can be a rewarding experience. In closing, I highly recommend the Hotel du College de France. It is a quaint, traditional Parisian hotel in a terrific neighborhood. A good value for Paris and a great find.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel for the money!”
Reviews.Author: TXDon
Reviews.Content: This is a very nice hotel in a very good location. Rooms are small as usual for europe but it's nice!

Reviews.Title: “Great location, safe and clean.”
Reviews.Author: valise
Reviews.Content: Just back from a few days at the Hotel du College du France and it does deserve all the plaudits it receives. It is a simple hotel - those looking for marble and gilt luxury, in- house restaurants or or masses of space should look elsewhere - but is clean (the bathroom was sparkling which is something I find important ) the beds were very comfortable and it is quiet ( on a side street) yet within easy walking distance of all the attractions of the Latin Quarter (and 2 Metro stops and the RER). The decor is quite subdued and on what I assume to be a heraldic theme with statues of knights etc., , to echo the College de France at the end of the street - we thought the stairs looked a bit shabby when we arrived, but it turned out they were in the middle of relaying the carpet (no disruption to guests that I could see) and that was half completed by the time we left. The staff, from the manager and reception staff through to the chambermaids are all very friendly and helpful - and it feels like a genuine charm, not a forced corporate cheeriness. We took the breakfast in the little breakfast room - at 8e, I didn't see many places cheaper nearby and it was generous (help yourself to as much as you need, with cheese, ham and yogourts in addition to nice fresh croissants and bread , with individual large jugs of coffee and hot milk brought to your table ) We were on the top floor in one of the superior rooms, which gives a bit more space - a great and unexpected view of the top half of Eiffel tower lit up at night was possible by looking out of the window to the right.

Reviews.Title: “Another great stay!”
Reviews.Author: maven74
Reviews.Content: When we found another great airfare deal to Paris, we knew we had to stay here again. We stayed in the 6th floor room 63. I loved that we had a view outside. We had a bit of warm weather in March and were able to enjoy a breeze when we opened the windows. The hotel had been upgraded since our last stay. We had a flat screen TV and ceiling fan (which we didn't use since the weather was just right). I noticed that the carpeting had been replaced and now there were sensored lights in the hallway. I can't say enough about this hotel. They have a wonderful & friendly staff, free internet use, and it's close to the major sights. We didn't have the breakfast since we perefer to eat on the go but it always smelled & looked good. This is not a luxury hotel but definitely comfortable and you can't beat the price. The metro/bus stops are close by, you are surrounded by lots of restaurants and bakeries, you can walk to Notre Dame & Luxemburg gardens-and if you're a walker like me, even to the Eiffel Tower. I highly recommend this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Frantastic Paris Accommodation”
Reviews.Author: Frasalx2
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for one week in April/May 2007. This hotel is in a wonderful location in the Latin quarter, and the service is fantastic. Room 23 is just what I thought a Paris hotel would be like, lace curtains, french doors and a little balcony with table and 2 chairs. The ensuite was a good size and had a great shower and the bath was greatly appreciated after a day of exploring Paris. At 97 euro a night for the double room this is great value for a Paris hotel in a great location. The staff were wonderful and we will be staying here on our return trip to Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Highly recommend!!!”
Reviews.Author: jcliberte
Reviews.Content: My husband and I have always stayed at the Minerve (6 times). I read about this hotel and we decided to give it a try. This place is terrific!! I loved the location. It was not on a busy street so we found it quiet. The staff are so accomodating and friendly. We were fortunate to book early and had the room on the top floor that is very large. It had a terrace with table and chairs...I couldn't believe it! I looked to the right @ night and could see the Eiffel Tower lit up!!! The bathroom was large. I know the other rooms are much smaller and would certainly be happy with any room we could get because this hotel is tops! We had dinner reservations at Le Coup Chou and Le Petit Prince. We were only 1/1/2 blocks from the restaurants!!!!! We will DEFINITELY return here next year. Make your reservations as early as you can!!!

Reviews.Title: “This Hotel made me feel I was at home in Paris”
Reviews.Author: incredibletrip
Reviews.Content: When I arrived in Paris I had problems with the hotel I had booked, than my travel agency told me about Hotel du College de France and I fortunately could find a room there.I just loved it. My room was provide with two large windows, with a nice view - the sun and light coming insid, it was very nive. The bathroom was Ok, and the hotel staff was very helpfull during all the time. This hotel made my Paris' time be better than always ! I stayed before in more expansive hotels ,with smaller rooms and without real windows. I really recomend College du France as a very charmous place to stay in Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location and value, but ask for a street view”
Reviews.Author: jooli_ash
Reviews.Content: Excellent location only 5-10 min walk from Notre Dame and Metro / RER station just around the corner. Streets unbeliveably quiet and calm - no traffic noise. Very reasonable rates. Latin quarter is a good place to stay; we have stayed north of the river before, and I prefer the charm of Latin Quarter / St Germain. Lots of reasonably priced restaurants for all tastes and pockets, especially those on Rue Moufftard the other side of the Pantheon, a short walk. Le Pre Verre restaurant directly opposite had great reviews, but book in advance if you want a table. Our room (16) on 1st floor looked onto the wall of the building adjacent and at the bottom of the shaft so rather dark and not very romantic. All other rooms on the floor had a street view, so if this is important you could request one of those. Room 14 (and those above to 5th floor) has the small lift shaft next to it, but I don't know how noisy it is. Rooms were small but clean, and quiet. There was no a/c but a ceiling fan, which was useful even in April. The safe in the room was a bit temperamental, but we were offered one next to the reception desk instead. Staff very friendly, and didn't automatically answer in english when we tried to speak french, which was nice. We were able to leave bags at reception on our last morning after we checked out, which was also useful. Overall, very good value, although we would have preferred a street view.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay in Hotel du College”
Reviews.Author: LuluSanFrancisco
Reviews.Content: We had a great stay at this hotel. Excellent location and not noisy. The staff was very helpful and friendly, especially Mr. Santa Ana. The rooms are adequate in size and we liked having a hair dryer and a safe in the room. It was clean, except the shower could have been scrubbed more to bring out a shine. We will definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and lovely staff!”
Reviews.Author: cls1979
Reviews.Content: We stayed here in the middle of March 2007. Having been told by other people of nightmare experiences at hotels in Paris, I was slightly apprehensive! However, we had a great stay - the staff were extremely friendly and always prepared to recommend restaurants, etc. They also were very patient with our stumbling French! The room was a good size and very clean - the only down side was the view as we were facing an inner courtyard, so the room was always rather dark - as we were out and about most of the time, that really didn't matter at all. The best thing about this hotel (apart from the cost, which is very reasonable) is the location. It was a really great base to walk out from and see the sights, plus there were loads of good restaurants and bars very close by. If we go back to Paris we'll definitely stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Charming, safe and friendly”
Reviews.Author: rainsoaked
Reviews.Content: After much research I chose this hotel primarily based on location and positive reviews, including several by solo female travellers which was important since I was travelling alone. Overall I thought this hotel had excellent value for the price. Every employee I encountered, from the desk clerks to the maids, were smiling and friendly but at the same time unobtrusive. There is a free computer with internet for guest use, and one of the clerks let me print my boarding pass from his computer. My room on the 5th floor was perfect for me (perhaps a bit small for a couple) but very bright and airy with large windows in the room and bathroom. The room was simply furnished but comfortable and spotless. I had breakfast each day, (I love the big pots of coffee and milk!) which had decent croissants, baguettes, yogurt, ham, cheese and juice. The hotel is central but on a very quiet street. My only negative experience came from the amount of noise in the room above me. I didn't hear anyone else, but the walls must be pretty thin, and also the couple above me spoke in really loud voices. For some reason the first night they woke me up at 4:30 am shouting from bathroom to bedroom, laughing and carrying on at full volume. I thought maybe they were getting up for an early flight or something but when it continued in the same manner for 20 minutes or so, I gave a few sharp raps to my ceiling. Dead silence, and I heard not a peep from them during the rest of my stay, except for their door opening and closing. I'm sure they didn't realize how loud they were being. Anyway, when I mentioned it to the desk clerk he was very sorry and told me to call the desk day or night should anything like that happen again. All in all, a nice place and I wouldn't hesitate to stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Look No Further”
Reviews.Author: chagness
Reviews.Content: I researched for days trying to find a suitable hotel in Paris. It's definately scary going to another country with no idea where to stay and no one you know who can recommend something to you. Look no further... This hotel was great. The rooms are small but quaint, which is to be expected of Paris. I booked a standard double at 97 euros per night. My room had two sets of french doors which led out onto a large balcony with a seating place. It was adorable. The hotel is located in a great neighborhood with lots of cafes around and not too far from Notre Dame. The front desk speaks english and is very helpful. My advice though, do not take the Metro in from the airport. It's a long ride and a long walk with luggage. Find another way! Mr. Santa Ana was a great help. Don't let the fact that you have to call the hotel to make reservations scare you. They speak english and are very patient if you want to try out your French. Just remember the time difference when calling.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Stay!”
Reviews.Author: crs319
Reviews.Content: After doing much research on Paris hotels using TripAdvisor and other websites, I decided to book a 4 night stay at the Hotel du College de France. I was traveling with a friend (we're both in our early twenties) and this was our first trip to Paris. The value and location seemed hard to beat. I couldn't have been happier with the choice. First of all, the location is excellent. We used the RER "B" coming from CDG airport and had only a short walk to the hotel. It was easy to find and because it is just off of Boulevard St. Germain, it is in a quiet location. However, you are still only steps away from a variety of restaurants, cafes, bakeries, and sandwich type places. Also, the location puts you only a few minutes walk to Notre Dame and the islands and the shops in Saint Germain. There are bus stops a stone's throw away, which make getting to places like the Eiffel Tower very easy. And of course, there are several Metro stops that are very convenient as well. The front desk staff couldn't have been nicer. We arrived early in the morning (8:30) after a flight from the US and were very tired. Check-in was a breeze and our room was available right then. The staff were very helpful with transportation questions and arranging for an early morning cab-ride to the train station on the day of our departure. As for the hotel itself, it is quaint and served our needs perfectly. The free internet access was a big plus. Breakfast wasn't a huge selection but a nice assortment of croissants, pain au chocolat, yogurt, jams and spreads, coffee, tea, hot chocolate, and meats and cheeses. Our room was small by US standards but it was adequate. The bed was comfy and we had a nice flat screen TV with a good selection of stations including the BBC news. The room also had a closet, desk area w/chair, phone, safe, and 2 large windows. The bathroom was very clean and the shower had great water pressure. Our room was cleaned impeccably each day. Overall, I would not hesitate to recommend this hotel to anyone staying in Paris. The value is incredible for a large city like Paris. I look forward to staying at the Hotel du College de France again!

Reviews.Title: “Charming, Friendly Hotel”
Reviews.Author: DCTraveler82
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel from 10 February to 15 February 2007 and the place was a delight! The hotel is centrally located in the heart of the Latin Quarter (near the Sorbonne and Notre Dame) and is a very short walk from RER line B which connects directly to Charles de Gaulle airport. I was travelling with a friend and, upon our arrival, the proprietor greeted us with a cheery "Welcome Home," a line which did not disappoint for the rest of our trip. The front desk staff was always helpful, directing us to the post office, easily providing items we might need to borrow, and was extremely helpful in arranging us a VERY early morning (430 AM) taxi back to the airport, complete with a wake-up call. The rooms are a bit on the small side, but provided more than enough space for myself and my friend, and were well maintained throughout our visit. They also have several extras, including TV (with BBC World), free internet, and a safe in each room. Overall, an excellent value for the service level and location! I would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “A charming hotel in the heart of Paris”
Reviews.Author: IsaacBlue
Reviews.Content: I stayed a total of three nights at this charming hotel and would readily recommend it to anyone who is looking for a clean, safe, well located, affordable and, most importantly, well run hotel in Paris. The hotel is literally within a stone's throw from Notre Dame. The staff could not have been more helpful and efficient, particularly those I dealt with such as Jesus Santa, Mr. Sadr and the wonderful proprietor himself, Jean Marc. I found the rooms to be nicely appointed and a good size (in Parisian terms!) and featured clean bathrooms (a big plus!) and all the amenities one could expect in a hotel of this size. All rooms have internet connections, but there is a computer terminal available in the main lobby for guests as well. The breakfast was quite acceptable, although a few other items such as fresh fruit would be quite welcome. I would definitely book again with this hotel. FYI: I stayed on the fifth floor which has small balconies in each room as well as better views of the surrounding buildings. For those who can splurge more, the 6th floor features two of the biggest rooms in the hotel but those are apparently hard to book as they're quite in demand. Thank you Jean Marc for creating such a memorable place for visitors to Paris!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location - friendly & well run hotel.”
Reviews.Author: Mick M
Reviews.Content: This was a great value 2 star hotel - one of the best 2 star hotels we have stayed in. We really enjoyed the location. It is so close to the St Michel Metro line which gives great access to all the major tourist attractions (including both major airports) and coming back to the Latin Quarter at night after touring around Paris was a real buzz. We generally walked around Paris and you can easily walk to Notre Dame, Musee de Louvre, Champs Elysees, Palace des Invalids and many other notable sights from Rue Thenard where the hotel is located. Even though the weather was freezing cold, the city was alive with tourists and locals walking between restaurants, cafes and taverns until past midnight. On our first night, Christmas Eve, we checked into the hotel quite late (10:30pm) and then went to a Greek style restaurant only 10 mins walk away for a really good late supper. Hotel staff were friendly, able to speak English, always on duty (24hrs) and more than willing to help with directions and advice. The room was small but felt really comfortable and was well cleaned every day. Also, even though there was no bath in the ensuite, the shower was strong and hot which was perfect for the winter time.

Reviews.Title: “Love this Hotel!!! 3rd time!”
Reviews.Author: Madeliefje
Reviews.Content: I love this hotel. I have stayed here 3 times......and will every time I go back to Paris. The staff is very friendly & helpful! Nice rooms, good location.....You should definitely stay here!!!

Reviews.Title: “Stayed 3rd - 6th November...”
Reviews.Author: BlueTattoo
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at this hotel from Friday 3rd to Monday 6th November. We had booked the room directly through the hotel after doing some tripadvisor searches for the areas we wished to stay in and the price we preferred to pay. As this hotel had good reviews and a perfect location, we chose it... The room we stayed in (14) was a lovely room with plenty of cupboard space and a comfy bed. The shower was really powerful and the temperature never varied (we tend to expect fluctuating pressure and temperatures when staying in European hotels so it was a pleasant surprise!) It was not a very big room but perfectly adequate for our stay. We did not intend to spend much time in the room anyway! The room had a flat screen tv on the wall, which we liked, but didn't have the radio alarm clock that all rooms should apparently have. We didn't need one so it didn't bother us, but it is just an observation. I'm sure the hotel would have provided one if we had asked, they seemed very friendly and keen to ensure our stay was enjoyable. The staff were really nice with us and humoured us as we spoke french. My husband and I both enjoy learning the languages and cultures of other countries and can find it slightly irritating when staff automatically start speaking to you in english like you're an idiot. Once they realised we really wanted to try the trip with no english, they were more than happy to oblige, which was nice! The breakfast was really nice - orange juice, coffee, tea, hot chocolate, milk, cereals (cornflakes and chocolate flakes), croissants, pains au chocolat, baguettes, ham and cheese, a selection of jams and marmalade were on offer every day. Thoroughly enjoyable! We checked out at about 11am on Monday and the hotel let us leave our suitcase in the room next to the reception desk all day. The only problem that I could see with this hotel in the near future would be if you intended staying during the week. There are roadworks currently being carried out. They started on Monday morning and, although this didn't bother us as we were up early anyway, they started early in the morning and are VERY loud. Our room wasn't even directly above them and wow, you could hear it! It also limited any conversation possibilities during breakfast. Might be wise to check with the hotel how long they're going on for, or request a room at the back of the hotel? The hotel's location is perfect. A very short walk away from the RER Ligne B that takes you to and from CDG airport. A couple of minutes walk from Notre Dame, the Batobus stop and the tour bus stops. There are two fantastic restaurants nearby also, Le Coupe Chou which was wonderful and not full of tourists. There were quite a few french people sitting around us and again, the waiter was happy to oblige and speak french only. Le Reminet is also really close (on the way to Notre Dame). I was apprehensive when we went in as it was full of tourists (one table with 3 american women was particularly loud and obnoxious) but the food turned out to be lovely. I was a bit irked when the waitress insisted upon speaking in english despite our repeated attempts at french but it turned out she was going to live in Boston shortly and wanted the practice, so we let her off with it!!! All in all, a lovely holiday in a lovely hotel in a great location...can't go wrong with that!!!

Reviews.Title: “Will always come back here when travelling to Paris!”
Reviews.Author: ElisaM
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel from Nov. 1 to Nov. 7/ 2006. First of all, you couldn't ask for a better location, especially at this price. The hotel was very easy to reach by RER, the train runs from Charles De Gaulle almost directly to St. Michel station, this station is less that 5 min. away on foot. Hotel College de France is walking distance to Notre Dame, St. Germain des Pres, la rue Mouffetard, the Seine, Ile de la Cite, La Samaritaine, the Louvre (a bit more of a walk), and rue la Huchette. The very cheerful and helpful staff are well-organized with maps of the area, sightseeing advice, a restaurant recommendation list, and their breakfast for 8E is the same price if you have it in the small breakfast area or if you have it brought to your room. Breakfast, by the way, was very good (croissants, chocolatines, ham, cheese, jams), but the best part was the big pitcher of coffee with the side of hot milk. Sure there are places in the area that serve breakfasts for a little less (cheapest I saw was 6.90E), but I need my coffee in the morning, and lots of it, and with coffee in the area at approx. 4E a cup, the 8E breakfast is a steal. The rooms are fairly big for Paris, very clean, very comfortable, charmingly decorated in a slightly spartan way. The cleaning staff doesn't start until around noon, so there's no noisy mornings. As a woman travelling alone, I always felt very secure at this hotel and the neighbourhood is very safe. Providing they don't jack up the prices too much, I will always stay at this hotel when travelling to Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Undiscovered gem...”
Reviews.Author: Jackalope
Reviews.Content: My grandfather stayed here and loved it. So did my parents. It was great then. It's even better now. For instance, free high-speed wireless Internet throughout the hotel, ceiling fans and very clean, updated showers in every room. I now live in Paris, near this hotel. Now I know the owner (he happened to be one of our neighbors for awhile). Great guy and cares a lot about how his customers enjoy their stay at the hotel. We sent our friends there when they're in town. I'm not sure if it's cool or not to post a link in these reviews (if not, please let me know -- don't want to break the rules). But it's worth checking the place out: (--)

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel with Small Child - Good value for Location”
Reviews.Author: Izzy123
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for one night in Sept 2006. I believe we stayed in Room 62, on the very top floor, right hand side. By Paris standards, the room was a good size and comfortably fit a roll-away bed for our 2 1/2 year old. The bathroom was clean and newly updated with a terrific shower/bath. Original beams added charm to otherwise plain yet fine decor. A nice bonus was the small balcony which fit a tiny table/chairs AND a view of the top of the Eiffel Tower. Great for an evening glass of wine! Staff friendly and a decent, typical breakfast. Excelent location esp. for the price. Would go back and recommend to anyone seeking a well priced, small hotel in a great location.

Reviews.Title: “Great small hotel in excellent location”
Reviews.Author: TexanInCharlotte
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at this hotel for 2 nights in late September 2006. It's an excellent small hotel in a perfect location -- easy walk to the heart of the Latin Quarter, Siene, both islands, Notre Dame, Saint Chappelle, etc, but on a small street with minimal noise (our cab driver hadn't even heard of the street, it's that small! So take some directions if arriving by cab - it's easy to find off St. Germain and Rue des Ecoles, once the driver knows that). The owner and front desk staff are great - even gave us a second wake-up call at 4:45 a.m. to ensure we were up and wouldn't miss our early flight. The elevator works well and goes up to the 5th of 6th floors, which isn't the case everywhere. You can't beat this place for the price and location in Paris. We'd definitely return.

Reviews.Title: “A terrific hotel in Paris”
Reviews.Author: 4Mike
Reviews.Content: For a perfect place to stay in Paris try the Hotel Du College De France. It is not one of those stuffy hotels but rather, a small, family run hotel. The owner, who check us in, was very helpful and spoke English very well. Later that day he was helpful in giving us directions on our walk and close by restaurants. They even called and made our restaurant reservations for us. They have a free internet for the guests also. The breakfast was very nice and was in a very small, pleasant room. Probably one of the best things about the hotel was the location. Right in the Latin Quarter yet on a quite street. Only a couple minute walk to the busy streets. All the tourist sites were only a short walk so we never did take the subways. We paid only 93 Euros plus 8 for breakfast and it was a real bargin. The rooms are small without air-cond. but they were very clean and updated. Mike Whitman

Reviews.Title: “Not a great summer choice”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: After a very warm welcome things went downhill past. Ongoing repairs in the hotel made for a dusty mess on my floor. Had to climb over tools to get to the room. No AC -- REPEAT NO AC!!! Then was awakened to 7:30 a.m. construction next door. The room was moderate size but not very modern, except the TV and the (nonfunctional) safe. I moved out -- to great apologies and a discount, but they didn't make up for a pretty awful experience.

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice Two Star Hotel”
Reviews.Author: JustOneBoomer
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hotel du College de France for 4 nights in early June. We had stayed there before in 1995. The hotel is still in the same family, but is now owned and managed by a nephew who was very helpful and professional and spoke excellent English. Sometimes the front desk was covered by someone less polished, but the service was still acceptable even then. The hotel is in an excellent location, on a small street off Rue Saint Germain, so it is fairly quiet. It is walking distance to Notre Dame and Saint Chapelle. It is a block from the Sorbonne and a block from the Cluny Museum (of medieval art, including the unicorn tapestry). There are many restaurants in the area and perhaps because of the student presence, they were on the less expensive side for Paris. The metro and RER are a 2 block walk. Our room was small, but the space was well planned. The bathroom had definitely been upgraded since our last visit. There was a shower-tub and plenty of hot water with good water pressure. Our room was not air conditioned and a few days were in the 80's. There was a fan in our room when we checked in which was sufficient for us at this time of year. There are large windows which open, but as is the case all over France, there are no screens. There is an old cage elevator and a spiral staircase. The hotel might not be appropriate for people with mobility issues and not being able to use the stairs would be a problem in the event of an emergency. Our room rate was 95 Euros, including taxes, which is about $114 if I am doing the math correctly. Breakfast is not included, but is available for 8 euros. You can get a cheaper breakfast on the street. We did not eat breakfast at the hotel until the last morning. I think it was a very fair value. There was a very good restaurant right across the street (25.50 for the menu of the day). Most of the patrons were French (which meant some smoking), but the meal was one of the best we had in France. The restaurant is very popular, so reservations would be necessary.

Reviews.Title: “Great Small Hotel”
Reviews.Author: janearlgarcia
Reviews.Content: Being that it was our first trip to Paris, it was nice that we were not disappointed in our hotel. After taking weeks to figure out where to stay and reading many reviews, it's still a risk whether or not the hotel would live up to expectations. Hotel du College was great. Friendly staff and comfortable rooms. The location was also good. Near many places to eat around blvd. st. germain. Ultimately, it was a great deal for the price. So if you want to keep it under 150 euros(which is hard to find) and want something nice, this is the place.

Reviews.Title: “Lived up to the reputation!”
Reviews.Author: Peachgone
Reviews.Content: Great location, great hotel, great service. We were travelling with three teenage children and had two rooms booked with Mr Sadr in early April. The reviews on this site attracted us to the location and we certainly weren't dissappointed. The rooms were spotless and well appointed - yes they are small but who lives in their room with Paris beckoning. Restaurants everywhere - even McDonalds just down the road for the kids. From the hotel it is pretty much a short walk to just about anywhere. Easy to find off the RER when we arrived with instructions off the web site and the rooms were available immediately at 9.00am in the morning - most appreciated after a 26 hour flight from Oz. Well done guys - we loved the stay and we'll be back!

Reviews.Title: “2nd time”
Reviews.Author: 1Michelle
