Reviews.Content: This was my second visit in 2006. The rooms are comfortable and not small compared to other Parisian hotels. Everything is clean and comfortable. The staff are pleasant and will help you with anything, if you request. The taxi service they use is great, compared to the standard Parisian taxi service. Book far in advance, they are popular!!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location for a small, friendly hotel!”
Reviews.Author: waytogogirl
Reviews.Content: I only spared this hotel the highest rating because I don't want to mislead consumers into thinking this is anything more than a very basic hotel. But, given it's two star rating, it is probably the best small hotel I have ever stayed in. The staff were very helpful and kind. The location could honestly not have been better. I am saying this after several trips to Paris. I stayed around the corner last time at Hotel St. Jacques, and this hotel on Rue Thenard was on a side street which made it very quiet in comparison to the Rue Des Ecoles address for the St. Jacques. The price was great and the rooms, although very basic in decor and small in size had many upgrades and updates for such an old building. There was a dressing table with two outlets which was very convenient. The bathroom we had was rather large. We had two windows. I would tell anyone who had to have a stylish decor or upscale amenities to go elsewhere, but if you are looking for a very friendly hotel with great location and price, you probably won't find anything better!!

Reviews.Title: “Friendly Two Star Hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I found CDF on a website for woman traveling alone, where it was recommended as a safe hotel. Three of us stayed here in the middle of March and we all loved it. Each of our rooms was perfect for one person. The bathrooms were spotless and the decor, although a bit shabby, was clean. There were tall windows that we propped open because the heat was on. (It was very cold outside.) None of our rooms smelled of smoke. One of us had a tiny balcony off of her 5th floor room that looked down on a side street that dead-ended to a charming little church. One had a room at the front of the hotel and the third had one that overlooked an interior courtyard (this room was the quietest.) None of us had a problem sleeping at night, despite some rowdy student protests nearby due to the proximity of the university a block away. When we came home late at night the front door was locked, we rang the bell, and were quickly admitted by one of the nice young men (Fabrice and Bruno) who worked the front desk at night. We had breakfast there several mornings, wonderful baguettes, cheese and croissants, great coffee. We also found brasseries and cafes within a block or two for cafe creme (pronounced "krem", equivalent of a latte.) We had dinner at the restaurant across the street (Le Pre Verre?) which was pricey but wonderful, a very adventurous and unusual menu. We also walked up rue Thenard, went left on rue des Ecoles, took the first right and then the first left, to come to Le Petit Prince, which was one of the best meals we had in the neighborhood for the money. It is also a lovely and popular restaurant. Mr. Santa Ana at the front desk recommended Le Petit Zinc, got us a reservation and a cab to the restaurant which is located not far away near St Germain de Pres church, and the food was fantastic. I honestly don't think you can get a bad meal in Paris. They do eat dinner later there, around 8:30 or 9, but if you have an earlier reservation, they don't seem to rush you out. The location of CDF of course couldn't be better. We walked to the river and Notre Dame almost every morning to start our day. Walked to the Louvre and to the Cluny (we love the Cluny.) There are many classical music concerts in churches all over Paris and there are some within walking distance of CDF. You'll usually find brochures and flyers advertising these concerts at the front desk. We rode buses that ran West on rue des Ecoles and came back to CDF on buses that ran East on Blvd St-Germain. We stayed out of the subway for two reasons: the gangs of kids that target people in the Metro who don't move quickly like they know where they're going, in other words, tourists; and second, if we went underground we would have missed seeing the beautiful parks and buildings of the city. All three of us would stay at the Hotel College de France again. We only hope that nothing changes it before we have a chance to come back again!

Reviews.Title: “Top Marks for Top Hotel”
Reviews.Author: MrTwick
Reviews.Content: My partner and I stayed here from Feb 9th to 12th for our Valentines weekend getaway. We were going to book a hotel + eurostar package but we were not happy with the hotels on offer so decided to book our trip and hotel separate (this actually worked out a little cheaper in the end) We chose College du France based on previous reviews and because it fitted with our budget. The location of the Hotel is excellent, 5 mins from Notre Dame. Rooms are clean, basic and simple with great views. Service is outstanding being personal and very friendly. The hotel felt really Parisian which is what I wanted, there are so many other faceless hotels out there and this little place really breaks the mould. Being a same sex couple we were a little worried that we may have been made to feel unwelcome or awkward but this wasnâ€™t the case and we really enjoyed our stay and were made to feel comfortable. I couldnâ€™t recommend this hotel higher and will certainly be staying here again.

Reviews.Title: “A Perfect Fit!”
Reviews.Author: schmittyUVA
Reviews.Content: The Hotel du College de France was exactly what I wanted and expected! I chose the HCF based on TA reviews for the hotel for the trip on which I proposed to my girlfriend. As soon as we turned down the rue Thenard, I knew I made the right choice. The hotel is situated on a quiet corner of the Boulevard Saint Germain. Its facade is simple and elegant. Upon entry, the quaint feel of the HCF is apparent and palpable. The warm tones of the hotel really make the hotel cozy. We were checked in by the hotel manager who was helpful from the beginning. Our check in was simple and quick, and we were in our room within minutes. The elevator is quite small, so I took the bags up while my fiancee walked up the amazing spiral staircase. We were given Room 23, a corner room with a balcony overlooking the streets below and the College de France (I feel that our room had the best location but apparently was smallest, based on the comparison of the hotel diagram). The room had a sizeable closet, a safe, two wicker chairs, a mirror and table, TV and internet connection. The bathroom was smallish as well, but had a toilet, sink, mirror, and deep tub and handheld shower head that we both learned to love after walking the city. The front desk keeps your key for you every time you leave, and at night a member of the staff attends the locked door. All of the staff were friendly and helpful. The cleaning staff were extremely friendly, respecting our wishes about when we wanted our room cleaned. They even did things like hold doors and turn on lights that gave the HCF staff a family feel. The location of the HCF was ideal. The 5th Arr. was perfect for us with a bustle during the day and minimal noise in the evening. The college and tourist atmosphere was exactly what I wanted out of our Parisian experience. There were both Metro and RER stops close by, and great places to eat, among them two great food stands with great crepes, several 24 hr. brasseries and cafes, a pastry shop, and a great street that was always busy called rue de la Huchette that had many small bars, food stands, and great atmosphere as there was always something happening. I rate the HCF as excellent for what it is. It does not try to be a four star resort but make the most of its two stars, a comfortable value in a great Parisian neighborhood. Our first night was a bit noisy, but it seemed that it was the result of some renovations. Our neighbors (in the hotel) and staff were up and working by 9 and could sometimes be heard. The outside noise was minimal to nonexistant, a quiet street for the neighborhood. If you're looking for a clean comfortable value near the 5th Arr., you must check out the Hotel du College de France. We will certainly be returning in our future visits!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: marilynvan
Reviews.Content: Stayed one week March 11-17, 2005. Hotel staff was very helpful, especially the tall young student who spoke French with an English accent. He was always offering safety tips for our stay in Paris & was very helpful in the details of replacing my friend's lost passport. Our breakfast the last day was delicious & beautifully served. Wonderful location close to everything you need, food, metro, etc. Quiet, even in area with so many students.

HotelInfo.Name: Hotel du College de France
HotelInfo.Address: 7 rue thenard, 75005 Paris, France
